translations.text: Wainnahum lana laghaithoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and they have enraged us,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "And they are raging furiously against us;

verses.text: وَ إِنَّا لَجَمِيعٌ‌ حَاذِرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و ما گروهی هوشیار و آماده باش و مهیای دفاعیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و ما همگى آماده پيكاريم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و ما همگى آماده‌ى پيكار هستيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و[لى‌] ما همگى به حال آماده‌باش درآمده‌ايم.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و ما لشکری همه نیرومند و مسلح به اسلحه کاملیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (البتّه جای هیچ گونه نگرانی نیست، و لیکن) ما گروهی هستیم محتاط (و بیدار و دوراندیش). [[«جَمِیعٌ»: گروه و دسته. جمع (نگا: قمر / 44). «حَاذِرُونَ»: افراد محتاط و دوراندیش. آگاه و بیدار.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و ما انبوهی مسلح هستیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و ما همگی آماده پیکاریم!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و هر آینه مائیم همگی بیمناکان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و بى‌گمان ما گروهى همپشت و سلاح‌داران آماده پيكاريم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «و محققاً ما نیروی مهم به هم پیوسته و وابسته‌ایم، (که) به حال آماده‌باش (درآمده‌ایم).

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: But we are a fully accounted army."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “And indeed we are an alert army.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and we are a host on our guard.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And verily we are host well-provided.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "But we are host all assembled, amply fore-warned."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But we are a vigilant multitude.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: But we are a numerous host, ever on guard."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "But we are a host all assembled, amply forewarned."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And lo! we are a ready host.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and we are alert and fully prepared.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and we are a host on our guard'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And indeed, we are a cautious society... "

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: who have enraged us greatly.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And most surely we are a vigilant multitude.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wainna lajameeAAun hathiroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: we are a large and watchful force."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "But we are a multitude amply fore-warned."

verses.text: فَأَخْرَجْنَاهُمْ‌ مِنْ‌ جَنَّاتٍ‌ وَ عُيُونٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس ما آنان را [به دنبال بنی اسرائیل] از باغ ها و چشمه سارها [که نعمت های ما در سرزمین مصر بود] بیرون کردیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس ايشان را از باغها و چشمه‌سارها بيرون كرديم،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس ما آنها را از باغ‌ها و چشمه‌سارها بيرون كرديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: سرانجام، ما آنان را از باغستانها و چشمه‌سارها،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس (با وجود این همه دعوی‌ها) ما آنها را از باغهای مصفّا با نهرهای آب روان بیرون کردیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (سرانجام آنچه می‌بایست بشود شد، و عاقبت بنی‌اسرائیل بر فرعون و فرعونیان پیروز شدند) و ما آنان را از باغها و چشمه‌سارها بیرون راندیم. [[«جَنَّاتٍ وَ عُیُونٍ»: مراد باغهای سرسبز و چشمه‌ساران پر آب مصر است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنگاه ایشان را از باغها و چشمه‌ها آواره کردیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (سرانجام فرعونیان مغلوب شدند،) و ما آنها را از باغها و چشمه‌ها بیرون راندیم،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس برون راندیمشان از باغها و چشمه‌سارها

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس آنان را از بوستانها و چشمه‌سارها بيرون آورديم،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس آنان را از باغستان‌های سردرهم و چشمه‌سارانی بیرون راندیم؛

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So We made them leave the gardens and springs of water,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: We therefore got them out from the gardens and water springs.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So We expelled them from gardens and fountains,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then We drave them forth from gardens and springs.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So, We expelled them from gardens and springs,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So We drove them out of gardens and springs.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Thus did We drive them out of their gardens and springs

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So, We expelled them from gardens and springs,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Thus did We take them away from gardens and watersprings,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So We took them out of gardens and springs,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: As such We expelled them from their gardens and their fountains,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So We removed them from gardens and springs

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We are warning all of you about them."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So We turned them out of gardens and springs,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faakhrajnahum min jannatin waAAuyoonin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: So We made them leave their gardens and springs,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So We expelled them from gardens, springs,

verses.text: وَ کُنُوزٍ وَ مَقَامٍ‌ کَرِيمٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: واز گنج ها ومکان های نیکو [وقصرهای باشکوه بیرون کردیم].

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و از گنجها و خانه‌هاى نيكو،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و از گنج‌ها و اقامتگاه‌هاى نيكو

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و گنجينه‌ها و جايگاه‌هاى پر ناز و نعمت بيرون كرديم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و نیز از گنج‌ها و ثروتها و مقامات عالیه ریاست بیرون آوردیم (و به دریای هلاک افکندیم).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و (ایشان را) از میان گنجها و کاخهای مجلّل (به در کردیم). [[«کُنُوزٍ»: گنجها. «کَرِیمٍ»: مراد ارزشمند و مجلّل و مزیّن و خوش و زیبا است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و از گنجها و جایگاه نیکو

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و از گنجها و قصرهای مجلّل!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و گنجها و جایگاهی گرامی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و از گنجها و جايگاه نيكو و بزرگوارانه.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و (نیز از) گنجینه‌ها و جایگاه‌هایی پر کرامت [:ناز و نعمت].

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And treasures and agreeable mansions.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And from treasures and nice houses.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and treasures and a noble station;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And treasures and a station noble.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Treasures, and every kind of honourable place.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And treasures and noble dwellings.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and their treasures and excellent dwellings.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Treasures, and every kind of honorable place.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And treasures and a fair estate.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and [made them leave behind] treasures and stately homes.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: their treasures and a noble station.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And treasures and honorable station -

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We deprived them (the unbelievers) of gardens, springs,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And treasures and goodly dwellings,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wakunoozin wamaqamin kareemin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: their treasures and their noble dwellings --

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Treasures, and every kind of honourable position;

verses.text: کَذٰلِکَ‌ وَ أَوْرَثْنَاهَا بَنِي‌ إِسْرَائِيلَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: این گونه [نعمت های خود را از چنگ آنان بیرون آوردیم] و آنها را به بنی اسرائیل به میراث دادیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بدين سان همه را به بنى اسرائيل وا گذاشتيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بدين‌سان بنى اسرائيل را وارث آنها كرديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [اراده ما] چنين بود، و آن [نعمتها] را به فرزندان اسرائيل ميراث داديم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آری این چنین کردیم و (قوم ضعیف) بنی اسرائیل را وارث آن شهر و دیارها و ثروت و مقامها گردانیدیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: این چنین (شد که بنی‌اسرائیل پیروز گشتند) و آنها را میراث بنی‌اسرائیل کردیم. [[«کَذالِکَ»: کار چنین شد. در اینجا ترتیب طبیعی داستان مراعات نشده است. بلکه نتیجه و چکیده داستان گفته شده سپس به درازا از آن سخن رفته است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و بدین‌سان آنها را به بنی‌اسرائیل به میراث دادیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (آری،) اینچنین کردیم! و بنی اسرائیل را وارث آنها ساختیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بدینسان و ارث دادیمش به بنی‌اسرائیل‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: اينچنين [كرديم‌]، و آنها را به فرزندان اسرائيل به ميراث داديم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (اراده‌ی ما) چنین بود و آن (نعمت‌)ها را به فرزندان اسرائیل میراث دادیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Thus it was; and We made the children of Israel possess them.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So it was; and We made the Descendants of Israel its inheritors.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: even so, and We bequeathed them upon the Children of Israel.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Even so. And We caused the Children of Isra'il to inherit them.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Thus [We turned them (Pharaoh's people) out] and We caused the Children of Israel to inherit them.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So it was. And We made the Children of Israel inherit them.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: This happened with them; (but on the other hand), We enabled the Children of Israel to inherit those bounties.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Thus and We caused the Children of Israel to inherit them.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Thus (were those things taken from them) and We caused the Children of Israel to inherit them.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So it was; and We bequeathed them to the Children of Israel.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: As such we gave it to the Children of Israel.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Thus. And We caused to inherit it the Children of Israel.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: treasures, and graceful dwellings.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Even so. And We gave them as a heritage to the children of Israel.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Kathalika waawrathnaha banee israeela

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and We made the Children of Israel inheritors of these bounties.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Thus it was, but We made the Children of Israel inheritors of such things.

verses.text: فَأَتْبَعُوهُمْ‌ مُشْرِقِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: فرعونیان هنگام طلوع آفتاب آنان را دنبال کردند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: فرعونيان به هنگام برآمدن آفتاب از پى آنها رفتند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس هنگام برآمدن آفتاب از پى آنها رسيدند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس هنگام برآمدن آفتاب، آنها را تعقيب كردند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس صبحگاه فرعونیان موسی و بنی اسرائیل را تعقیب کردند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (فرعون و فرعونیان) بنی‌اسرائیل را تعقیب کردند و به هنگام طلوع آفتاب بدیشان رسیدند. [[«مُشْرِقِینَ»: به طلوع خورشید رسیدگان. از مصدر (إشراق) به معنی رسیدن به وقت شُروق که به معنی طُلوع است. همان گونه که (إصباح) به معنی داخل شدن در (صَباح) و (إمساء) به معنی رسیدن به (مَساء) است. (مُشرِقِینَ) می‌تواند حال ضمیر (و) و یا (هم) باشد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سپس ایشان را به هنگام طلوع آفتاب دنبال کردند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنان به تعقیب بنی اسرائیل پرداختند، و به هنگام طلوع آفتاب به آنها رسیدند.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس از پی ایشان بیامدند به هنگام خورشید تابان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس [سپاه فرعون‌] آفتابدم از پى ايشان رفتند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس (فرعونیان) در حال برآمدن آفتاب، آنان را تعقیب کردند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: But they pursued them at sunrise.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So the Firaun’s people followed them at sunrise.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then they followed them at the sunrise;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then they pursued them at sunrise.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So they pursued them at sunrise.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And they pursued them at sunrise.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: At sunrise they set off in pursuit of them

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So, they pursued them at sunrise.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And they overtook them at sunrise.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Then they pursued them at sunrise.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: At sunrise, they followed them.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So they pursued them at sunrise.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Thus we let the Israelites inherit them all.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then they pursued them at sunrise.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: FaatbaAAoohum mushriqeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Pharaoh and his people pursued them at sunrise,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So they pursued them at sunrise.

verses.text: فَلَمَّا تَرَاءَى‌ الْجَمْعَانِ‌ قَالَ‌ أَصْحَابُ‌ مُوسَى‌ إِنَّا لَمُدْرَکُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: چون آن دو گروه یکدیگر را دیدند، اصحاب موسی گفتند: حتماً ما به چنگ آنان خواهیم افتاد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: چون آن دو گروه يكديگر را ديدند، ياران موسى گفتند: گرفتار آمديم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و چون دو گروه همديگر را ديدند، ياران موسى گفتند: ما قطعا گرفتار خواهيم شد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: چون دو گروه، همديگر را ديدند، ياران موسى گفتند: «ما قطعاً گرفتار خواهيم شد.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: چون دو لشکر روبرو شدند اصحاب موسی گفتند: اینک به دست فرعونیان خواهیم افتاد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هنگامی که هر دو گروه یکدیگر را دیدند، یاران موسی گفتند: ما (در چنگال فرعونیان) گرفتار می‌گردیم (و هلاک می‌شویم). [[«تَرَاءَی»: دید. فعل ماضی باب تفاعل است و در رسم‌الخطّ قرآنی (تراءا) است. «مُدْرَکُونَ»: رسیدگان. گرفتارشدگان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و چون دو گروه همدیگر را دیدند، یاران موسی گفتند، ما گیر افتاده‌ایم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: هنگامی که دو گروه یکدیگر را دیدند، یاران موسی گفتند: «ما در چنگال فرعونیان گرفتار شدیم!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: تا گاهی که نمودار شدند (دیدار کردند) دو گروه گفتند یاران موسی که مائیم دریافتگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: چون آن دو گروه يكديگر را ديدند، ياران موسى گفتند: همانا ما گرفتارشدگانيم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس چون دو گروه، همدیگر را دیدند، همراهان موسی گفتند: «بی‌گمان ما ناگزیر(و ناگریز) مورد دستیابی هستیم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: When the two forces drew within seeing distance of each other, the people of Moses said: "We shall certainly be overtaken."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And when the two groups saw each other, those with Moosa said, “They have caught us.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and, when the two hosts sighted each other, the companions of Moses said, 'We are overtaken!'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And when the two parties saw each other, the companions of Musa said: verily we are overtaken.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And when the two hosts saw each other, the companions of Musa (Moses) said: "We are sure to be overtaken."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: When the two groups sighted each other, the followers of Moses said, “We are being overtaken.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and when the groups came face to face, the companions of Moses cried out: "We are overtaken!"

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And when the two hosts saw each other, the companions of Musa said: "We are sure to be overtaken."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And when the two hosts saw each other, those with Moses said: Lo! we are indeed caught.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: When the two hosts sighted each other, the companions of Moses said, ‘Indeed we have been caught up.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And when the two hosts came in view of each other, Moses' companions said: 'We have been reached'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And when the two companies saw one another, the companions of Moses said, "Indeed, we are to be overtaken!"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The people of the Pharaoh pursued them at sunrise.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So when the two hosts saw each other, the companions of Musa cried out: Most surely we are being overtaken.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Falamma taraa aljamAAani qala ashabu moosa inna lamudrakoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and when the two groups saw each other, Moses' companions said, "We are sure to be overtaken."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And when the two bodies saw each other, the people of Moses said: "We are sure to be overtaken."

verses.text: قَالَ‌ کَلاَّ إِنَ‌ مَعِيَ‌ رَبِّي‌ سَيَهْدِينِ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: موسی گفت: این چنین نیست، بی تردید پروردگارم با من است، و به زودی مرا هدایت خواهد کرد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: هرگز. پروردگار من با من است و مرا راه خواهد نمود.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفت: چنين نيست، بى‌ترديد پروردگارم با من است و به زودى هدايتم خواهد كرد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گفت: «چنين نيست، زيرا پروردگارم با من است و به زودى مرا راهنمايى خواهد كرد.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: موسی گفت: هرگز چنین نیست، که خدا با من است و مرا به یقین راهنمایی خواهد کرد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (موسی) گفت: چنین نیست. پروردگار من با من است. (قطعاً به دست دشمنم نمی‌سپارد و به راه نجات) رهنمودم خواهد کرد. [[«کلاّ»: چنین نیست. این واژه حرفی است که سخن پیش از خود را ردّ و نفی می‌کند. یعنی: نگوئید که فرعون و سپاهیانش به ما می‌رسد. «مَعِیَ»: (نگا: طه / 46).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [موسی‌] گفت چنین نیست، پروردگارم با من است و به زودی مرا راهنمایی خواهد کرد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (موسی) گفت: «چنین نیست! یقیناً پروردگارم با من است، بزودی مرا هدایت خواهد کرد!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت نچنین است همانا با من است پروردگارم زود است رهبریم کند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: [موسى‌] گفت: هرگز، كه پروردگار من با من است، مرا راه خواهد نمود.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفت: «هرگز چنان نیست؛ همواره پروردگارم با من است و به زودی مرا (معجزه آسا) راهنمایی خواهد کرد.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Moses replied: "By no means. My Lord is with me. He will show me the way."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Said Moosa, “Never! Indeed my Lord is with me, He will now show me the way.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Said he, 'No indeed; surely my Lord is with me; He will guide me.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Musa said: by no means; verily with me is my Lord; He shall guide me.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: [Musa (Moses)] said: "Nay, verily! With me is my Lord, He will guide me."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “No; my Lord is with me, He will guide me.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Moses said: "Certainly not. My Lord is with me; He will direct me."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: (Musa) said: "Nay, verily with me is my Lord. He will guide me."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He said: Nay, verily! for lo! my Lord is with me. He will guide me.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He said, ‘Certainly not! Indeed my Lord is with me. He will guide me.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: 'No, indeed' he replied, 'my Lord is with me and He will guide me'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [Moses] said, "No! Indeed, with me is my Lord; He will guide me."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: When the two groups came close to each other, the companions of Moses said, "We will be caught".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: By no means; surely my Lord is with me: He will show me a way out.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala kalla inna maAAiya rabbee sayahdeeni

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Moses replied, "No, My Lord is with me, and He will guide me."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (Moses) said: "By no means! my Lord is with me! Soon will He guide me!"

verses.text: فَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَى‌ مُوسَى‌ أَنِ‌ اضْرِبْ‌ بِعَصَاکَ‌ الْبَحْرَ فَانْفَلَقَ‌ فَکَانَ‌ کُلُ‌ فِرْقٍ‌ کَالطَّوْدِ الْعَظِيمِ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس به موسی وحی کردیم که عصایت را به این دریا بزن. [موسی عصایش را به دریا زد] پس [دریا] از هم شکافت و هر پاره اش چون کوهی بزرگ بود.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس به موسى وحى كرديم كه: عصايت را بر دريا بزن. دريا بشكافت و هر پاره چون كوهى عظيم گشت.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آن‌گاه به موسى وحى كرديم كه با عصاى خود بر دريا بزن. پس از هم شكافت و هر قسمت آن چون كوهى عظيم گرديد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس به موسى وحى كرديم: «با عصاى خود بر اين دريا بزن.» تا از هم شكافت، و هر پاره‌اى همچون كوهى سترگ بود.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس ما به موسی وحی کردیم که عصای خود را به دریا (ی نیل) زن، چون زد دریا شکافت و آب هر قطعه دریا مانند کوهی بزرگ بر روی هم قرار گرفت.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: به دنبال آن به موسی پیام دادیم که عصای خود را به دریا بزن. (وقتی عصا را به دریا زد) دریا از هم شکافت، و هر بخشی همچون کوه بزرگی گردید (و دوازده راه خشک در آن پدیدار شد، و هر گروهی از اسباط دوازده‌گانه‌ی بنی‌اسرائیل در جاده‌ای حرکت کرد). [[«إنفَلَقَ»: از هم شکافت. از هم باز شد. از هم جدا شد. «فِرْقٍ»: قِسم. بخش. مراد جوانب آبی است که واپس رفته است. «الطَّوْد»: کوه. کوه بزرگ. توصیف آن به عظیم در آیه، برای تأکید است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سپس به موسی وحی کردیم که با عصایت به دریا بزن، آنگاه [دریا] بشکافت و هر پاره‌ای از آن همچون کوهی بزرگ بود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و بدنبال آن به موسی وحی کردیم: «عصایت را به دریا بزن!» (عصایش را به دریا زد،) و دریا از هم شکافته شد، و هر بخشی همچون کوه عظیمی بود!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس وحی کردیم به موسی که بزن چوبدست خود را به دریا پس بشکافت و شد هر دیواری چون کوهی بزرگ‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس به موسى وحى كرديم كه عصاى خود را بر دريا بزن پس [دريا] بشكافت و هر پاره‌اى چون كوهى بزرگ گشت.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس سوی موسی وحی کردیم که: «با عصای خود بر (این) دریا بزن‌.» پس دریا از هم شکافت. پس هر پاره‌ای همچون کوهی سترگ بود.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We commanded Moses: "Smite the sea with your staff." And it parted, and every parting was like a lofty mountain.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So We sent the divine revelation to Moosa that, “Strike the sea with your staff”; thereupon the sea parted; so each part was like a huge mountain.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then We revealed to Moses, 'Strike with thy staff the sea'; and it clave, and each part was as a mighty mount.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then We revealed unto Musa, saying: smite thou the sea with thy staff. So it became separated, and each part was like unto a cliff mighty.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then We inspired Musa (Moses) (saying): "Strike the sea with your stick." And it parted, and each separate part (of that sea water) became like the huge, firm mass of a mountain.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We inspired Moses: “Strike the sea with your staff.” Whereupon it parted, and each part was like a huge hill.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Then We revealed to Moses, (commanding him): "Strike the sea with your rod." Thereupon the sea split up, and then each became like the mass of a huge mount.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then We revealed to Musa (saying): "Strike the sea with your stick." And it parted, and each separate part became like huge mountain.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then We inspired Moses, saying: Smite the sea with thy staff. And it parted, and each part was as a mountain vast.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Thereupon We revealed to Moses: ‘Strike the sea with your staff!’ Whereupon it parted, and each part was as if it were a great mountain.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Then We revealed to Moses: 'Strike the sea with your staff', so it divided and each part was as a mighty mount.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then We inspired to Moses, "Strike with your staff the sea," and it parted, and each portion was like a great towering mountain.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Moses said, "Certainly not. My Lord is with me and He will certainly guide me."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then We revealed to Musa: Strike the sea with your staff. So it had cloven asunder, and each part was like a huge mound.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faawhayna ila moosa ani idrib biAAasaka albahra fainfalaqa fakana kullu firqin kaalttawdi alAAatheemi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Then We bade Moses strike the sea with his staff. And it parted, and each part was like a huge mountain.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then We told Moses by inspiration: "Strike the sea with thy rod." So it divided, and each separate part became like the huge, firm mass of a mountain.

verses.text: وَ أَزْلَفْنَا ثَمَ‌ الْآخَرِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و آن گروه دیگر را [هم در آنجا] به دریا نزدیک کردیم،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و آن گروه ديگر را نيز به دريا رسانديم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و گروه ديگر (فرعونيان) را به آن جا نزديك كرديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و ديگران را بدانجا نزديك گردانيديم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و دیگران (یعنی فرعونیان) را (از پی بنی اسرائیل) به نزدیک دریا آوردیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و در آنجا دیگران را (نیز به موسی و بنی‌اسرائیل) نزدیک گرداندیم (و فرعون و فرعونیان را وارد آن راه‌های دوازده‌گانه کردیم). [[«أَزْلَفْنا»: نزدیک گرداندیم (نگا: شعراء / 90، / 31، تکویر / 13). «ثَمَّ»: آنجا. ظرف است. مراد وسط دریا است. «الآخَرینَ»: دیگران. مراد فرعون و لشکریان فرعون است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و دیگران را به آنجا نزدیک کردیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و در آنجا دیگران [= لشکر فرعون‌] را نیز (به دریا) نزدیک ساختیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و جای دادیم در آنجا دگران را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و آن ديگران- فرعونيان- را نزديك آنجا آورديم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و دیگران [:فرعونیان] را بدانجا (با صف‌آراییشان به غرق) نزدیک گردانیدیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Then We brought the others to that place.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And We brought the others close to that place.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And there We brought the others on,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We brought near thither the others.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then We brought near the others [Fir'aun's (Pharaoh) party] to that place.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And there We brought the others near.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: We also brought the other party close to the same spot,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then We brought near the others to that place.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then brought We near the others to that place.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: There, We brought the others near,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And there We brought the others on,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We advanced thereto the pursuers.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We sent a revelation to Moses saying, "Strike the sea with your staff." The sea was rent asunder and each side stood high up like a huge mountain.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We brought near, there, the others.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waazlafna thamma alakhareena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: In the meantime We made the others approach that place.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And We made the other party approach thither.

verses.text: وَ أَنْجَيْنَا مُوسَى‌ وَ مَنْ‌ مَعَهُ‌ أَجْمَعِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و موسی و هر که با او بود، همه را نجات دادیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: موسى و همه همراهانش را رهانيديم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و موسى و همه همراهانش را نجات داديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و موسى و همه كسانى را كه همراه او بودند نجات داديم؛

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و موسی و کلیه همراهانش را به ساحل سلامت رسانیدیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: موسی و جملگی همراهان او را نجات دادیم. [[«أَنجَیْنَا»: نجات دادیم.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و موسی و همراهانش، همگیشان را رهانیدیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و موسی و تمام کسانی را که با او بودند نجات دادیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و رهانیدیم موسی و آنان را که با او بودند همگی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و موسى و همه كسانى را كه با او بودند رهانيديم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و موسی را با همه‌ی کسانی که همراهش بودند نجات دادیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We delivered Moses and every one with him,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And We saved Moosa and all those with him.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and We delivered Moses and those with him all together;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We delivered Musa and those with him together.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And We saved Musa (Moses) and all those with him.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And We saved Moses and those with him, all together.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and We delivered Moses and his companions, all of them,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And We saved Musa and all those with him.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And We saved Moses and those with him, every one;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and We delivered Moses and all those who were with him.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and We saved Moses and those who were with him together,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We saved Moses and those with him, all together.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Then We brought the two parties closer.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We saved Musa and those with him, all of them.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waanjayna moosa waman maAAahu ajmaAAeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We delivered Moses and all those who were with him,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: We delivered Moses and all who were with him;

verses.text: ثُمَ‌ أَغْرَقْنَا الْآخَرِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آن گاه آن گروه دیگر را غرق کردیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و آن ديگران را غرقه ساختيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: سپس گروه ديگر را غرق كرديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آنگاه ديگران را غرق كرديم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آن گاه قوم دیگر همه را به دریا غرق کردیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: سپس دیگران را غرق کردیم.

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سپس دیگران را غرقه ساختیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: سپس دیگران را غرق کردیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: سپس به دریا فروبردیم دگران را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: سپس آن ديگران را غرق ساختيم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: سپس دیگران را غرق کردیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And We drowned the others.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Then drowned the others.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: then We drowned the others.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then We drowned the others.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then We drowned the others.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then We drowned the others.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: then We drowned the others.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then We drowned the others.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And We drowned the others.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Then We drowned the rest.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: then, We drowned the others.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then We drowned the others.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We saved Moses and all the people with him

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then We drowned the others.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Thumma aghraqna alakhareena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: then We drowned the others.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But We drowned the others.

verses.text: إِنَ‌ فِي‌ ذٰلِکَ‌ لَآيَةً وَ مَا کَانَ‌ أَکْثَرُهُمْ‌ مُؤْمِنِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بی تردید در این سرگذشت عبرتی بزرگ وجود دارد، و [قوم قبطی] بیشترشان مؤمن نبودند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: هرآينه در اين عبرتى است، و بيشترينشان ايمان نياوردند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: مسلما در اين [واقعه‌] عبرتى بود ولى بيشترشان مؤمن نبودند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: مسلماً در اين [واقعه‌] عبرتى بود، و[لى‌] بيشترشان ايمان‌آورنده نبودند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: همانا در این هلاک فرعونیان آیت بزرگی (برای عبرت و موعظه مردم) بود لیکن اکثر خلق ایمان نیاوردند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بی‌گمان در این (ماجرای نجات مؤمنان و غرق کافران) درس عبرت بزرگی است (برای کسانی که چشم باز و دل آگاه داشته باشند و درباره‌ی سرگذشت جبّاران مغرور بیندیشند و اوراق تاریخ مکتوب و منظور را به دقّت بخوانند و ببینند). ولی اکثر آنان ایمان نیاوردند (و کمتر ایشان، همچون آسیه و جادوگران، به جمع مؤمنان پیوستند). [[«آیَةً»: اندرز سترگ و عبرت بزرگ.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بی‌گمان در این مایه عبرتی هست، و بیشترینه آنان مؤمن نبودند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: در این جریان، نشانه روشنی است ولی بیشترشان ایمان نیاوردند! (چرا که طالب حق نبودند)

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا در این است آیتی و نیستند بیشترشان ایمان آرندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: هر آينه در اين نشانه و عبرتى است، و بيشترشان مؤمن نبودند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بی‌شک در این (واقعه‌ی عبرت‌انگیز) همانا نشانه‌ی (ربانیِ) بزرگی است. حال آنکه بیشترشان (از) مؤمنان نبوده‌اند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Verily there is a sign in this, but most of them do not believe.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Indeed in this is surely a sign, and most of them were not Muslims.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Surely in that is a sign, yet most of them are not believers.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily herein is a sign; but most of them are not believers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily! In this is indeed a sign (or a proof), yet most of them are not believers.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: In that there is a sign, but most of them are not believers.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of them are not believers.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: There is indeed a sign in that, but most of them do not have faith.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Surely, in that there is a sign; yet most of them do not believe.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and drowned the other party.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Most surely there is a sign in this, but most of them do not believe.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna fee thalika laayatan wama kana aktharuhum mumineena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Surely in that there is a sign; yet most of them do not believe:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Verily in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.

verses.text: وَ إِنَ‌ رَبَّکَ‌ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و یقیناً پروردگارت همان توانای شکست ناپذیر و مهربان است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: هرآينه پروردگار تو پيروزمند و بخشنده است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و قطعا پروردگار تو شكست‌ناپذير مهربان است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و قطعاً پروردگار تو همان شكست‌ناپذير مهربان است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و همانا خدای تو خدای بسیار مقتدر و مهربان است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بی‌گمان پروردگار تو با عزّت و توانا، و با محبّت و مهربان است. [[«الْعَزِیزُ»: توانا، در انتقام گرفتن از تکذیب کنندگان. «الرَّحِیمُ»: مهربان، در حق تصدیق کنندگان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: همانا پروردگارت پیروزمند مهربان است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و پروردگارت شکست‌ناپذیر و مهربان است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا پروردگار تو است هرآینه عزّتمند مهربان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و همانا پروردگار تو هموست تواناى بى‌همتا و مهربان.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و بی‌گمان پروردگار تو، همواره او همان کانون عزت (و) رحمت است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Indeed your Lord is mighty and merciful.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed your Lord – only He is the Almighty, the Most Merciful.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Surely thy Lord, He is the All-mighty, the All-compassionate.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And verily thy Lord! He is the Mighty, the Merciful.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And verily, your Lord! He is truly the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Surely, your Lord is the Almighty, the Merciful.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Verily your Lord is Immensely Mighty, Ever Compassionate.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And verily your Lord, He is truly the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And lo, thy Lord! He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed your Lord is the All-mighty, the All-merciful.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Surely, your Lord is the Almighty, the Most Merciful.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: In this there was certainly evidence (of the Truth), but most of them did not have any faith.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And most surely your Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wainna rabbaka lahuwa alAAazeezu alrraheemu

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: truly, your Lord is the Mighty One, the Merciful.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And verily thy Lord is He, the Exalted in Might, Most Merciful.

verses.text: وَ اتْلُ‌ عَلَيْهِمْ‌ نَبَأَ إِبْرَاهِيمَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و سرگذشت مهم ابراهیم را بر آنان بخوان،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و داستان ابراهيم را برايشان تلاوت كن.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و بر آنان خبر مهم ابراهيم را بخوان

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و بر آنان گزارش ابراهيم را بخوان.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و (ای رسول) حکایت ابراهیم را بر امت بیان کن.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (ای پیغمبر!) سرگذشت ابراهیم را برای کافران بیان دار. [[«نَبَأ»: خبر. مراد قصّه و سرگذشت است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و بر آنان داستان ابراهیم را بخوان‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و بر آنان خبر ابراهیم را بخوان،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و بخوان بر ایشان داستان ابراهیم را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و خبر ابراهيم را بر آنان برخوان،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و بر آنان گزارش مهم ابراهیم را برخوان.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Relate the news of Abraham to them.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And recite to them the news of Ibrahim.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And recite to them the tiding of Abraham

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And recite unto them the story of Ibrahim.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And recite to them the story of Ibrahim (Abraham).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And relate to them the story of Abraham.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And recount to them the story of Abraham:

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And recite to them the story of Ibrahim.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Recite unto them the story of Abraham:

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Relate to them the account of Abraham

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And recite to them the news of Abraham.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And recite to them the news of Abraham,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Your Lord is certainly Majestic and All-merciful.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And recite to them the story of Ibrahim.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waotlu AAalayhim nabaa ibraheema

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Tell them the story of Abraham,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And rehearse to them (something of) Abraham's story.

verses.text: إِذْ قَالَ‌ لِأَبِيهِ‌ وَ قَوْمِهِ‌ مَا تَعْبُدُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: هنگامی که به پدرش وقومش گفت: چه چیز را می پرستید؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آنگاه كه به پدر و قوم خود گفت: چه مى‌پرستيد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آن‌گاه كه به پدر خود و قومش گفت: چه مى‌پرستيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آنگاه كه به پدر خود و قومش گفت: «چه مى‌پرستيد؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: هنگامی که با پدر (یعنی عمو، زیرا پدران پیغمبران همه موحّدند) و با قومش گفت: شما چه معبودی را می‌پرستید؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هنگامی که به پدرش (آزر) و قوم (بت‌پرست) خود گفت: چه چیز را پرستش می‌کنید؟ (چیزهائی را که می‌پرستید، کی شایسته‌ی پرستش می‌باشند؟).

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: چنین بود که به پدرش و قومش گفت که شما چه می‌پرستید؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: هنگامی که به پدر و قومش گفت: «چه چیز را می‌پرستید؟!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: هنگامی که گفت به پدر خویش و قومش چه می‌پرستید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آنگاه كه به پدر خويش- آزر، سرپرست خويش- و قوم خود گفت: چه مى‌پرستيد؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: چون به پدر (تربیتی)اش و قومش گفت: «چه (چیزی را) می‌پرستید؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: When he asked his father and his people: "What do you worship?"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: When he said to his father and his people, “What do you worship?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: when he said to his father and his people, 'What do you serve?'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: When he said unto his father and his people: what worship ye?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: When he said to his father and his people: "What do you worship?"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: When he said to his father and his people, “What do you worship?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: when he asked his father and his people: "What do you worship?"

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: When he said to his father and his people: "What do you worship"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: When he said unto his father and his folk: What worship ye?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: when he said to his father and his people, ‘What is it that you are worshiping?!’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He said to his father and to his nation: 'What do you worship'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: When he said to his father and his people, "What do you worship?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Tell them the story of Abraham,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: When he said to his father and his people: What do you worship?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Ith qala liabeehi waqawmihi ma taAAbudoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: when he asked his father and his people, "What is that which you worship?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Behold, he said to his father and his people: "What worship ye?"

verses.text: قَالُوا نَعْبُدُ أَصْنَاماً فَنَظَلُ‌ لَهَا عَاکِفِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: گفتند: بت هایی را می پرستیم و همواره ملازم پرستش آنها هستیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفتند: بتانى را مى‌پرستيم و معتكف آستانشان هستيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفتند: بت‌هايى را مى‌پرستيم و همواره ملازم عبادت آنهاييم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گفتند: «بتانى را مى‌پرستيم و همواره ملازم آنهاييم.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: جواب دادند که ما بتهایی را می‌پرستیم و ثابت بر پرستش آنها بوده و هستیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (مفتخرانه پاسخ دادند و) گفتند: بتهای بزرگی را می‌پرستیم و دائماً (به پرستش آنها می‌پردازیم و) بر عبادتشان ماندگار می‌مانیم. [[«نَظَلُّ»: بر دوام می‌مانیم. از افعال ناقصه و بیانگر استمرار در کار است. «عَاکِفِینَ»: ملازمان عبادت (نگا: بقره / 187، اعراف / 138).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گفتند بتانی می‌پرستیم و در خدمت آنها معتکفیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: گفتند: «بتهایی را می‌پرستیم، و همه روز ملازم عبادت آنهاییم.»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفتند می‌پرستیم بتانی را پس می‌باشیم پیرامون آنها گردآمدگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفتند: بتانى را مى‌پرستيم و پيوسته سر بر آستانشان داريم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفتند: «بتانی را می‌پرستیم. پس همواره بر درگاه آنان همچنان باشندگان و خاضعانیم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They replied: "We worship idols and are devoted to them."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They said, “We worship idols, and we keep squatting in seclusion before them.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: They said, 'We serve idols, and continue cleaving to them.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: They said: we worship idols, and we are unto them ever devoted

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: They said: "We worship idols, and to them we are ever devoted."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They said, “We worship idols, and we remain devoted to them.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They answered: "There are some idols that we worship and are devoted to them with constancy."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: They said: "We worship idols, and to them we are ever devoted."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: They said: We worship idols, and are ever devoted unto them.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They said, ‘We worship idols, and are constant in our devotion to them.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: They replied: 'We worship idols and continue cleaving to them'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: They said, "We worship idols and remain to them devoted."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: when he asked his father and others, "What do you worship?"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: They said: We worship idols, so we shall be their votaries.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qaloo naAAbudu asnaman fanathallu laha AAakifeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They said, "We worship idols and will continue to cling to them."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: They said: "We worship idols, and we remain constantly in attendance on them."

verses.text: قَالَ‌ هَلْ‌ يَسْمَعُونَکُمْ‌ إِذْ تَدْعُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: گفت: آیا هنگامی که آنها را می خوانید، سخن شما را می شنوند؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: آيا وقتى آنها را مى‌خوانيد صدايتان را مى‌شنوند؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفت: آيا وقتى آنها را مى‌خوانيد از شما مى‌شنوند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گفت: «آيا وقتى دعا مى‌كنيد، از شما مى‌شنوند؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: ابراهیم گفت: آیا هر گاه این بتهای جماد را بخوانید سخن شما را می‌شنوند؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: گفت: آیا هنگامی که آنها را به کمک می‌خوانید، صدای شما را می‌شنوند و نیازتان را برآورده می‌کنند؟ [[«هَلْ یَسْمَعُونَکُمْ؟»: آیا دعا و سخن شما را می‌شنوند؟ آیا نیازتان را برآورده می‌کنند و به شما پاسخ می‌گویند؟]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [ابراهیم‌] گفت آیا چون آنان را به پرستش می‌خوانید، ندای شما را می‌شنوند؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: گفت: «آیا هنگامی که آنها را می‌خوانید صدای شما را می‌شنوند؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت آیا می‌شنوند شما را گاهی که می‌خوانید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفت: آيا هنگامى كه آنها را مى‌خوانيد آواز شما را مى‌شنوند؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفت: «آیا وقتی از آنها درخواستی می‌کنید، از شما می‌شنوند؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: (Abraham) asked: "Do they hear when you call them?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He said, “Do they hear you when you call?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: He said, 'Do they hear you when you call,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: He said: hearken they unto you when ye cry?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: He said: "Do they hear you, when you call (on them)?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “Do they hear you when you pray?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: He asked: "Do they hear you when you call them

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: He said: "Do they hear you when you call"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He said: Do they hear you when ye cry?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He said, ‘Do they hear you when you call them?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: 'Do they hear you when you call on them' He asked.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: He said, "Do they hear you when you supplicate?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They replied, "We worship idols and shall continue to worship them".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: Do they hear you when you call?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala hal yasmaAAoonakum ith tadAAoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: He asked, "Do they hear you when you call to them?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: He said: "Do they listen to you when ye call (on them)?"

verses.text: أَوْ يَنْفَعُونَکُمْ‌ أَوْ يَضُرُّونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: یا به شما سود و زیانی می رسانند؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: يا براى شما سود و زيانى دارند؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: يا به شما سود و زيان مى‌رسانند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: يا به شما سود يا زيان مى‌رسانند؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: یا به حال شما هیچ سود و زیانی توانند داشت؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: یا سودی به شما می‌رسانند (اگر از آنها اطاعت کنید؟) و یا زیانی متوجّه شما می‌سازند (اگر از آنها سرپیچی نمائید؟).

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: یا برای شما سودی یا زیانی دارند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: یا سود و زیانی به شما می‌رسانند؟!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: یا سودتان بخشند یا آیان رسانند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: يا شما را سود يا زيان مى‌رسانند؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «یا شما را سود یا زیانی می‌رسانند؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Or do they benefit you, or do you harm?"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “Or do they benefit you or harm you?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: or do they profit you, or harm?'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Or, benefit they you or hurt they you?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "Or do they benefit you or do they harm (you)?"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Or do they benefit you, or harm you?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: or do they cause you any benefit or harm?"

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Or do they benefit you or do they cause harm"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Or do they benefit or harm you?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Or do they bring you any benefit, or cause you any harm?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: 'Can they benefit you or harm you'

translations.name: Saheeh International

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Or do they profit you or cause you harm?

translations.text: Aw yanfaAAoonakum aw yadurroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Do they help or harm you?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Or do you good or harm?"

verses.text: قَالُوا بَلْ‌ وَجَدْنَا آبَاءَنَا کَذٰلِکَ‌ يَفْعَلُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: گفتند: نه، بلکه پدرانمان را یافتیم که به این صورت عبادت می کردند!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفتند: نه، پدرانمان را ديده‌ايم كه چنين مى‌كرده‌اند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفتند: [نه‌]، بلكه پدران خود را يافتيم كه چنين مى‌كردند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گفتند: «نه، بلكه پدران خود را يافتيم كه چنين مى‌كردند.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: گفتند: (نه) بلکه ما پدران خود را بر پرستش این بتان یافته‌ایم (و هر چند جماد بی‌اثری باشند می‌پرستیم).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: می‌گویند: (چیزی از این کارها را نمی‌توانند بکنند) فقط ما پدران و نیاکان خود را دیده‌ایم که این چنین می‌کردند (و بتان را به گونه‌ی ما پرستش می‌نمودند و ما هم از کارشان تقلید می‌کنیم و بس. مگر می‌شود پدران و نیاکان ما در اشتباه بوده باشند؟). [[«وَجَدْنَا»: یافته‌ایم. دیده‌ایم. «آبَاء»: پدران. مراد پدران و اجداد و نیاکان است (نگا: شعراء / 76).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گفتند نه ولی پدرانمان را یافتیم که چنین می‌کردند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: گفتند: «ما فقط نیاکان خود را یافتیم که چنین می‌کنند.»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفتند بلکه یافتیم پدران خود را چنین می‌کردند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفتند: بلكه پدرانمان را يافته‌ايم كه چنين مى‌كردند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفتند: «(نه!) بلکه پدران خود را یافتیم که چنان می‌کردند.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They said: "No. But we found our fathers doing so."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They said, “In fact we found our forefathers doing likewise.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: They said, 'Nay, but we found our fathers so doing.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: They said: nay; but we found our fathers doing in this wise.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: They said: "Nay, but we found our fathers doing so."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They said, “But we found our ancestors doing so.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They answered: "No; but we found our forefathers doing so."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: They said: "(Nay) but we found our fathers doing so."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: They said: Nay, but we found our fathers acting on this wise.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They said, ‘Indeed, we found our fathers doing likewise.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: They replied: 'No, but we found our fathers doing so'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: They said, "But we found our fathers doing thus."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: or can they benefit or harm you?"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: They said: Nay, we found our fathers doing so.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qaloo bal wajadna abaana kathalika yafAAaloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They replied, "But we found our fathers doing the same."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: They said: "Nay, but we found our fathers doing thus (what we do)."

verses.text: قَالَ‌ أَ فَرَأَيْتُمْ‌ مَا کُنْتُمْ‌ تَعْبُدُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: گفت: پس آیا می دانید که آنچه می پرستید،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: آيا مى‌دانيد كه چه مى‌پرستيده‌ايد،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفت: آيا در آنچه مى‌پرستيده‌ايد تأمل كرده‌ايد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گفت: «آيا در آنچه مى‌پرستيده‌ايد تأمّل كرده‌ايد؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: ابراهیم باز به آنها گفت: آیا می‌دانید که این بتهایی که شما مردم اینک می‌پرستید،

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا (می‌دانید که چه کار می‌کنید و) می‌بینید که چه چیز را می‌پرستید؟! [[«أَفَرَأَیْتُمْ؟»: آیا می‌بینید؟ مراد از دیدن، اندیشیدن و دانستن و به اصل مسأله پی بردن است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [ابراهیم‌] گفت آیا در آنچه می‌پرستید تامل نکرده‌اید؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: گفت: «آیا دیدید (این) چیزهایی را که پیوسته پرستش می‌کردید...

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت آیا دیدید آنچه را بودید می‌پرستیدید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفت: آيا ديده‌ايد- يا دانسته‌ايد، يعنى ببينيد و بدانيد- آنچه مى‌پرستيده‌ايد،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفت: «آیا پس آنچه را می‌پرستیده‌اید نگریستید؛»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: He said: "Have you considered what you have been worshipping,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He said, “Do you see these – (the idols) whom you worship?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: He said, 'And have you considered what you have been serving,

translations.text: He said: "Do you observe that which you have been worshipping,

translations.name: Talal Itani

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Thereupon, Abraham said: "Have you seen (with your eyes) those whom you have been worshipping,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He said: See now that which ye worship,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: He said, "Then do you see what you have been worshipping,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They said, "No, but our fathers worshipped them."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: Have you then considered what you have been worshipping:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala afaraaytum ma kuntum taAAbudoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Abraham said, "Have you really thought about what you have been worshipping,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: He said: "Do ye then see whom ye have been worshipping,-

verses.text: أَنْتُمْ‌ وَ آبَاؤُکُمُ‌ الْأَقْدَمُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: هم شما و هم پدران پیشین شما

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati

translations.text: شما و نياكان گذشته شما

translations.text: شما و پدران پيشين شما؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و پدران شما از قدیم می‌پرستیدند،

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هم شما و هم پدران پیشین شما. [[«أَنتُمْ»: تأکید ضمیر فاعلی در آیه قبلی است. «الأقْدَمُونَ»: پیشینیان و گذشتگان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: هم شما و هم نیاکان کهنتان‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: شما و پدران پیشین شما،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: شما و پدران شما پیشتران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: شما و پدران پيشترتان؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «شما و پدران پیشترین شما؟»

translations.text: You and your fathers?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “You and your forefathers preceding you.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: you and your fathers, the elders?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Ye and your fathers of old?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "You and your ancient fathers?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: You and your ancient ancestors?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "You and your ancient fathers"

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: you and your ancestors?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: You and your ancient forefathers?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Abraham) said, "Do you know that what you worship and what your grandfathers worshipped

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir

translations.text: Antum waabaokumu alaqdamoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
