translations.text: "'Besides Allah? Can they help you or help themselves?'

verses.text: فَکُبْکِبُوا فِيهَا هُمْ‌ وَ الْغَاوُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس آن بت ها و گمراهان [که آنها را می پرستیدند] به رو در آتش افروخته افکنده می شوند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آنها و كافران را سرنگون در جهنم اندازند،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس آنها و همه گمراهان به حالت سرنگون در آن [آتش‌] افكنده شوند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس آنها و همه گمراهان در آن [آتش‌] افكنده مى‌شوند،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: در آن حال کافران و معبودان باطلشان هم به رو در آتش دوزخ افتند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پس از آن، آنان (که پرستش شوندگان گمراهساز) همراه گمراهان (که پرستش کنندگان ایشان بودند) پیاپی به دوزخ سرنگون افکنده می‌شوند. [[«کُبْکِبُوا»: سرنگون و پیاپی فرو افکنده می‌شوند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنگاه ایشان و گمراهان [دیگر] در آن سرنگون شوند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: در آن هنگام همه آن معبودان با عابدان گمراه به دوزخ افکنده می‌شوند؛

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس به روی افکنده شدند در آن ایشان و گمراهان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس آنها و گمراهان نگونسار در آنجا افكنده شوند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس آنان و (همه‌ی) گمراهان در آن آتش شعله‌ور به رو افکنده شدند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They will then be thrown into Hell with those who had gone astray

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So they and all the astray were flung into hell.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then they shall be pitched into it, they and the perverse

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then they shall be hurled therein, they and the seduced ones.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then they will be thrown on their faces into the (Fire), They and the Ghawun (devils, and those who were in error).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then they will be toppled into it, together with the seducers.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Then the idols and those who strayed will be hurled into the Fire headlong, one upon another,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then they will be thrown on their faces into it (the Fire), they and the astray.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then will they be hurled therein, they and the seducers

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Then they will be cast into it on their faces—they and the perverse,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And they will be pitched into it, they and the perverse

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So they will be overturned into Hellfire, they and the deviators

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The idol worshippers, the idols, the rebellious ones,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So they shall be thrown down into it, they and the erring ones,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fakubkiboo feeha hum waalghawoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Then they will be thrown headlong into Hell, both they and the misguided ones,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Then they will be thrown headlong into the (Fire),- they and those straying in Evil,

verses.text: وَ جُنُودُ إِبْلِيسَ‌ أَجْمَعُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: با همه سپاهیان ابلیس،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و همه سپاهيان ابليس را.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و نيز همه سپاهيان ابليس

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و [نيز] همه سپاهيان ابليس.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و نیز تمام سپاه شیطان (به جهنم در آیند).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و جملگی لشکریان اهریمن (نیز همراه آن دو گروه به دوزخ سرنگون می‌گردند). [[«جُنُودُ إِبْلِیسَ»: لشکریان و یاوران ابلیس. مراد پیروان ابلیس، یعنی جنایتکاران و معصیت پیشگان سراسر تاریخ است (نگا: اعراف / 18، حجر / 43).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و سپاهیان ابلیس همگی‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و همچنین همگی لشکریان ابلیس!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و سپاه‌های ابلیس همگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و سپاهيان ابليس نيز همگان.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و (نیز) همه‌ی سپاهیان ابلیس.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Together with the hordes of Iblis.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And all the armies of Iblis. (Satan)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and the hosts of Iblis, all together.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And the hosts of Iblis together.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And the whole hosts of Iblis (Satan) together.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And the soldiers of Satan, all of them.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and so too the hosts of Iblis, all of them.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And all of the hosts of Iblis together.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And the hosts of Iblis, together.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and the hosts of Iblis all together.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and the hosts of iblis all together.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And the soldiers of Iblees, all together.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and the army of satan will all be thrown headlong into hell.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And the hosts of the Shaitan, all.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wajunoodu ibleesa ajmaAAoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and Satan's legions, all together.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "And the whole hosts of Iblis together.

verses.text: قَالُوا وَ هُمْ‌ فِيهَا يَخْتَصِمُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: در حالی که در آن [آتش افروخته] با هم ستیز و نزاع می کنند [و به بتان] می گویند:

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و در حالى كه در جهنم با يكديگر به نزاع پرداخته‌اند، مى‌گويند:

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آنها در آن جا در حالى كه با يكديگر ستيزه مى‌كنند گويند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آنها در آنجا با يكديگر ستيزه مى‌كنند [و] مى‌گويند:

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و در دوزخ به مجادله و خصومت با یکدیگر گویند:

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آنان (که معبودهای دروغین را پرستیده‌اند) در آنجا به کشمکش (با معبودهای خود) می‌پردازند و می‌گویند: [[«وَ هُمْ فِیهَا یَخْتَصِمُونَ»: جمله حالیّه است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: در حالی که در آنجا با همدیگر ستیزه می‌کنند گویند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنها در آنجا در حالی که به مخاصمه برخاسته‌اند می‌گویند:

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفتند و ستیزه می‌کردند در آن‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و در حالى كه در آنجا با يكديگر ستيزه مى‌كنند، گويند:

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: حال آنکه آنان در آتش شعله‌ور با یکدیگر نزاع می‌کنند، گفتند:

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Disputing among themselves they will say:

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And they will say, and they will be quarrelling in it:

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: They shall say, as they dispute there one with another,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And they, While contending therein, shall say:

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: They will say while contending therein,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They will say, as they feud in it.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: There they will quarrel with one another and the erring ones will say (to their deities):

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: They will say while contending therein,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And they will say, when they are quarrelling therein:

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They will say, as they wrangle in it [together],

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And they will say while they dispute with one another,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: They will say while they dispute therein,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: "Quarrelling therein with each other,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: They shall say while they contend therein:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qaloo wahum feeha yakhtasimoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They will dispute between themselves therein, and will say,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "They will say there in their mutual bickerings:

verses.text: تَاللَّهِ‌ إِنْ‌ کُنَّا لَفِي‌ ضَلاَلٍ‌ مُبِينٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: به خدا سوگند که ما در گمراهی آشکاری بودیم،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: به خدا سوگند كه ما در گمراهى آشكار بوديم،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: سوگند به خدا كه ما در گمراهى آشكارى بوديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: «سوگند به خدا كه ما در گمراهى آشكارى بوديم،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: به خدا قسم که ما در گمراهی بسیار آشکاری بودیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: به خدا سوگند ما در گمراهی آشکاری بوده‌ایم. [[«إِن کُنَّا»: واژه (إِنْ) مخفّف از مثقّله و در اصل چنین است: إِنَّا کُنَّا.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: به خدا ما در گمراهی آشکار بودیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: «به خدا سوگند که ما در گمراهی آشکاری بودیم،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: سوگند به خدا همانا بودیم ما در گمراهی آشکار

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: به خدا سوگند كه هر آينه ما در گمراهى آشكارى بوديم،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «سوگند به خدا که ما همواره در ژرفای گمراهی آشکارگری بوده‌ایم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "By God, we were plainly in error

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “By oath of Allah, we were indeed in open error.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: 'By God, we were certainly in manifest error

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: By Allah, we have indeed been in an error manifest.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: By Allah, we were truly in a manifest error,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: “By God, We were in evident error.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: "By Allah, we were surely in clear error

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "By Allah, we were truly in a manifest error,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: By Allah, of a truth we were in error manifest

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: ‘By Allah, we had indeed been in manifest error

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: 'By Allah, we were certainly in clear error,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: "By Allah, we were indeed in manifest error

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: they will say, "By God, we were in clear error

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: By Allah! we were certainly in manifest error,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: TaAllahi in kunna lafee dalalin mubeenin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: "We were clearly misguided

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "'By Allah, we were truly in an error manifest,

verses.text: إِذْ نُسَوِّيکُمْ‌ بِرَبِ‌ الْعَالَمِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: که شما را با پروردگار جهانیان برابر و مساوی قرار می دادیم،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آنگاه كه شما را با پروردگار جهانيان برابر مى‌دانستيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آن‌گاه كه شما [معبودان‌] را با پروردگار جهانيان برابر مى‌داشتيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آنگاه كه شما را با پروردگار جهانيان برابر مى‌كرديم،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که شما (بتها) را مانند خدای عالمیان پرستش می‌کردیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آن زمان که ما شما (معبودان دروغین) را با پروردگار جهانیان (در عبادت و طاعت) برابر می‌دانستیم. [[«إِذْ»: زمانی که. ظرف زمان گمراهی است. یا (إِذْ) تعلیلیّه است (نگا: زخرف / 39).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: چرا که شما را با پروردگار جهانیان برابر می‌شمردیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: چون شما را با پروردگار عالمیان برابر می‌شمردیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: هنگامی که یکسان داشتیم شما را با پروردگار جهانیان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آنگاه كه شما را با پروردگار جهانيان برابر مى‌داشتيم

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «چون شماها را با پروردگار جهانیان برابر می‌نمودیم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: In equating you with the Lord of all the worlds;

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “When we considered you equal to the Lord Of The Creation.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: when we made you equal with the Lord of all Being.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: When we equalled you with the Lord of the worlds.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: When We held you (false gods) as equals (in worship) with the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists);

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: For equating you with the Lord of the Worlds.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: when we assigned to you a position equal to that of the Lord of the Universe.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "When we held you as equals with the Lord of all that exists;"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: When we made you equal with the Lord of the Worlds.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: when we equated you with the Lord of all the worlds!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: when we made you equal with the Lord of the Worlds.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: When we equated you with the Lord of the worlds.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: when we considered you equal to the Lord of the Universe.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: When we made you equal to the Lord of the worlds;

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Ith nusawweekum birabbi alAAalameena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: when we made you equal with the Lord of the Universe.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "'When we held you as equals with the Lord of the Worlds;

verses.text: وَ مَا أَضَلَّنَا إِلاَّ الْمُجْرِمُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و ما را جز مجرمان [خائن] گمراه نکردند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و ما را جز مجرمان گمراه نساختند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و ما را جز مجرمان گمراه نكردند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و جز تباهكاران ما را گمراه نكردند،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و ما را گمراه نکردند جز قوم تبهکار.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و ما را جز بزهکاران (شیاطین نام) گمراه نکرده است. [[«الْمُجْرِمُونَ»: مراد شیطان و یاوران او، یا رؤساء و کبراء ایشان است (نگا: احزاب / 67).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و جز گناهکاران کسی ما را گمراه نکرد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: امّا کسی جز مجرمان ما را گمراه نکرد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و گمراه نکردند ما را مگر گنهکاران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و ما را جز بزهكاران گمراه نساختند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و جز مجرمان ما را گمراه نکردند.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: No one but the sinners led us astray.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “And none misled us but the guilty.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: It was naught but the sinners that led us astray;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And none led us astray except the Culprits.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And none has brought us into error except the Mujrimun [Iblis (Satan) and those of human beings who commit crimes, murderers, polytheists, oppressors, etc.].

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: No one misled us except the sinners.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: It is none but those steeped in guilt who led us into this error,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "And none has brought us into error except the criminals."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: It was but the guilty who misled us.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: No one led us astray except the guilty.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: It was nothing but the evildoers who led us astray.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And no one misguided us except the criminals.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Only the sinful ones made us go astray.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And none but the guilty led us astray;

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wama adallana illa almujrimoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: It was the evildoers who led us astray,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "'And our seducers were only those who were steeped in guilt.

verses.text: فَمَا لَنَا مِنْ‌ شَافِعِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: در نتیجه برای ما نه شفیعانی است،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و اكنون ما را شفيعانى نيست.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اكنون ما را هيچ شفيعى نيست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: در نتيجه شفاعتگرانى نداريم،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس (در این روز سخت) نه شفیعی داریم،

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (ای وای بر ما! امروز) ما اصلاً شفاعت کنندگانی نداریم (که ما را برهانند! ما که معتقد به میانجیگری میانجیگران برای نجات خود بودیم). [[«مِن شَافِعِینَ»: واژه (مِنْ) بیانگر عمومیّت نفی چیزی است که پس از آن قرار دارد (نگا: تفسیر المصحف المفسّر).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: حال هیچ شفیعی نداریم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (افسوس که امروز) شفاعت‌کنندگانی برای ما وجود ندارد،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس نیست ما را شفاعت‌گرانی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: اينك ما را هيچ شفاعت‌كننده و خواهشگرى نيست

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «پس هیچ گونه شفاعتگرانی نداریم،»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Now we have none to intercede for us,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “So now we do not have any intercessors.” (The believers shall have intercessors, the disbelievers none).

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: so now we have no intercessors,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: So none we have as intercessors.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Now we have no intercessors,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Now we have no intercessors.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and now we have none to intercede on our behalf,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Now we have no intercessors,"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Now we have no intercessors

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Now we have no intercessors,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We have no intercessors now,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So now we have no intercessors

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We have no one to intercede for us before God

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So we have no intercessors,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fama lana min shafiAAeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and we have no intercessors now,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "'Now, then, we have none to intercede (for us),

verses.text: وَ لاَ صَدِيقٍ‌ حَمِيمٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و نه یک دوست نزدیک و صمیمی،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و ما را دوست مهربانى نيست.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و نه دوست مهربانى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و نه دوستى نزديك.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و نه یک دوست صمیمی (که از ما حمایتی کند).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (همچنین، امروز) دوست صمیمی و دلسوزی هم نداریم (تا دست کم گریه‌ای برای ما سر دهد). [[«حَمیمٍ»: گرم. مراد صمیمی و دلسوز است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و نه دوستی مهربان‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و نه دوست گرم و پرمحبّتی!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و نه دوستی مهربان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و نه دوست دلسوز و مهربانى.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «و نه دوستی خون‌گرم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Nor any sincere friend.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “Nor a caring friend.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: no loyal friend.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Nor any loving friend.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Nor a close friend (to help us).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And no sincere friend.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: nor do we have a truly sincere friend.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Nor a close friend."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Nor any loving friend.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: nor do we have any sympathetic friend.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: no caring friend.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And not a devoted friend.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: nor a loving friend.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Nor a true friend;

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wala sadeeqin hameemin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and no sincere friend.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "'Nor a single friend to feel (for us).

verses.text: فَلَوْ أَنَ‌ لَنَا کَرَّةً فَنَکُونَ‌ مِنَ‌ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس ای کاش برای ما بازگشتی [به دنیا] بود تا از مؤمنان می شدیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: كاش بار ديگر به دنيا باز گرديم تا از مؤمنان گرديم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: اى كاش ما را برگشتى بود تا از مؤمنان مى‌شديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اى كاش كه بازگشتى براىِ ما بود و از مؤمنان مى‌شديم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: ای کاش که بار دیگر (به دنیا) باز می‌گشتیم تا (به خدای یگانه) ایمان می‌آوردیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: کاش! (به جهان) برگشتی داشتیم تا از زمره‌ی مؤمنان می‌شدیم (و در پرتو ایمان درست و اعمال شایسته، از عذاب دوزخ نجات می‌یافتیم و به بهشت در می‌آمدیم). [[«لَوْ»: واژه (لَوْ) در اینجا در معنی (لَیْتَ) و برای تمنّی است. «کَرَّةً»: رجعت. برگشت. مراد برگشت به جهان است (نگا: مؤمنون / 99 و 100).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: کاش برای ما بازگشتی بود، تا آنگاه از مؤمنان می‌شدیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ای کاش بار دیگر (به دنیا) بازگردیم و از مؤمنان باشیم!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: کاش ما را بازگشتی بودی تا می‌شدیم از مؤمنان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: كاش ما را [به دنيا] بازگشتى مى‌بود تا از مؤمنان مى‌شديم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «پس کاش (بر فرض محال،) بازگشتی برای ما بود تا بی‌گمان از مؤمنان باشیم؟!‌»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: If only we could return and be among the believers!"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “So if only were we to go back, in order to become Muslims!”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: O that we might return again, and be among the believers!'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Were there for us a return, we would be of the believers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: (Alas!) If we only had a chance to return (to the world), we shall truly be among the believers!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: If only we could have another chance, we would be among the faithful.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: If only we could return we would be among the believers."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "(Alas!) If we only had a chance to return, we shall truly be among the believers!"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Oh, that we had another turn (on earth), that we might be of the believers!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Had there been another turn for us, we would be among the faithful.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Would that we might return again, and be among the believers'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then if we only had a return [to the world] and could be of the believers... "

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Would that we could have a chance to live again so that we might become believers."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: But if we could but once return, we would be of the believers.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Falaw anna lana karratan fanakoona mina almumineena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: If we could only return to the world and be among the believers."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "'Now if we only had a chance of return we shall truly be of those who believe!'"

verses.text: إِنَ‌ فِي‌ ذٰلِکَ‌ لَآيَةً وَ مَا کَانَ‌ أَکْثَرُهُمْ‌ مُؤْمِنِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بی تردید در این سرگذشت، عبرتی بزرگ وجود دارد، و [قوم ابراهیم] بیشترشان مؤمن نبودند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: در اين عبرتى است، و بيشترينشان ايمان نياوردند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: حقا در اين [سرنوشت‌] درس عبرتى است، ولى اكثر آنان مؤمن نبودند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: حقاً در اين [سرگذشت درس‌] عبرتى است و[لى‌] بيشترشان مؤمن نبودند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: همانا در این (ندامت گمراهان) آیت عبرتی (برای دیگران) بود و لیک اکثر مردم باز ایمان نیاوردند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بی‌گمان در این (سرگذشت ابراهیم) پند و عبرتی (برای عاقلان قوم تو و سایر فرزانگان) است، ولی (جای تعجّب است) بیشتر آنان ایمان نداشته (و ایمان نمی‌آورند). [[«آیَةً»: پند و اندرز. درس عبرت.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بی‌گمان در این مایه عبرتی هست، و بیشترینه آنان مؤمن نبودند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: در این ماجرا، نشانه (و عبرتی) است؛ ولی بیشتر آنان مؤمن نبودند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا در این است آیتی و نیستند بیشتر ایشان ایمان‌آرندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: همانا در اين نشانه و عبرتى است و بيشترشان مؤمن نبودند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: همانا در این (سرگذشت) همواره نشانه‌ای است و بیشترشان (از) مؤمنان نبوده‌اند (که یا کافر بودند، و یا قاصر که نه مؤمن و نه کافر بودند).

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Verily there is a sign in this, but many of them do not believe.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Indeed in this is a sign; and most of them were not believers.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Surely in that is a sign, yet most of them are not believers.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily herein is a sign, but most of them are not believers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily! In this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Surely in this is a sign, but most of them are not believers.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of them are not believers!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: There is indeed a sign in that; but most of them do not have faith.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Surely, in that there is a sign, yet most of them do not believe.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: In this there is evidence (of the truth), but many of them do not have any faith.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Most surely there is a sign in this, but most of them do not believe.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna fee thalika laayatan wama kana aktharuhum mumineena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: There is certainly a sign in that, but most of them would not believe:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Verily in this is a Sign but most of them do not believe.

verses.text: وَ إِنَ‌ رَبَّکَ‌ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و یقیناً پروردگارت همان توانای شکست ناپذیر و مهربان است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: هر آينه پروردگار تو پيروزمند و مهربان است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و به راستى پروردگار تو شكست ناپذير مهربان است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و در حقيقت، پروردگار تو همان شكست‌ناپذير مهربان است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و همانا خدای تو خدای بسیار مقتدر و مهربان است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: قطعاً پروردگارت (بر انتقام از بی‌دینان) توانا و (نسبت به مؤمنان) مهربان است. [[«وَ إِنَّ رَبَّکَ ...»: تکرار این نوع جمله‌ها دلداری مؤثّری است برای پیغمبر و مؤمنان اندک صدر اسلام، و برای اقلیت مؤمنان در برابر اکثریّت گمراهان در هر عصر و زمان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و همانا پروردگارت پیروزمند مهربان است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و پروردگار تو عزیز و رحیم است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا پروردگار تو او است عزّتمند مهربان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه پروردگار تو هموست تواناى بى‌همتا و مهربان.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و به‌راستی، پروردگار تو همواره همان کانون عزت (و) رحمتگر بر ویژگان است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Verily your Lord is mighty and merciful.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed your Lord – only He is the Almighty, the Most Merciful.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Surely thy Lord, He is the All-mighty, the All-compassionate.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And verily thy Lord! He is the Mighty, the Merciful.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And verily, your Lord! He is truly the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Your Lord is the Almighty, the Merciful.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Verily Your Lord is Immensely Mighty, Ever Compassionate.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And verily your Lord, He is truly the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And lo, thy Lord! He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed your Lord is the All-mighty, the All-merciful.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Surely, Your Lord is the Almighty, the Most Merciful.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Your Lord is certainly Majestic and All-merciful.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And most surely your Lord is the Mighty, the Merciful.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wainna rabbaka lahuwa alAAazeezu alrraheemu

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: surely, your Lord is the Mighty One, the Merciful.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And verily thy Lord is He, the Exalted in Might, Most Merciful.

verses.text: کَذَّبَتْ‌ قَوْمُ‌ نُوحٍ‌ الْمُرْسَلِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: قوم نوح پیامبران را تکذیب کردند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: قوم نوح پيامبران را تكذيب كردند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: قوم نوح، پيامبران را تكذيب كردند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: قوم نوح پيامبران را تكذيب كردند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: قوم نوح هم پیغمبران خدا را تکذیب کردند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (ماجرای آموزنده‌ی دیگری مربوط به قوم نوح است). قوم نوح پیغمبران را تکذیب کردند. [[«کَذَّبَتْ ...»: قوم نوح با تکذیب نوح، همه پیغمبران را نیز تکذیب کرده‌اند، چرا که تکذیب پیغمبری، تکذیب همه پیغمبران بشمار است؛ شاید هم قوم نوح، منکر همه پیغمبران و به طور کلّی همه ادیان آسمانی بوده‌اند (نگا: فرقان / 37). تأنیث فعل (کَذَّبَتْ) به خاطر این است که واژه (قوم) به صورت مذکّر و مؤنّث به کار می‌رود، و به طور کلّی هر اسم جمعی فعل آن می‌تواند به صورت مذکّر و مؤنّث ذکر شود.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: قوم نوح پیامبران را دروغگو می‌انگاشتند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: قوم نوح رسولان را تکذیب کردند،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: تکذیب کردند قوم نوح فرستادگان را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: قوم نوح پيامبران را دروغگو شمردند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گروه نوح پیامبران را تکذیب کردند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: The people of Noah accused the apostles of lies.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: The people of Nooh denied the Noble Messengers.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: The people of Noah cried lies to the Envoys

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And Nuh's people belied the sent ones.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: The people of Nuh (Noah) belied the Messengers.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: The people of Noah disbelieved the messengers.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: The people of Noah gave the lie to the Messengers.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: The people of Nuh denied the Messengers.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Noah's folk denied the messengers (of Allah),

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: The people of Noah impugned the apostles

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: The nation of Noah, belied their Messengers.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: The people of Noah denied the messengers

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The people of Noah rejected the Messengerss.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: The people of Nuh rejected the apostles.
