translations.text: Wainnahu latanzeelu rabbi alAAalameena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: This surely is a revelation from the Lord of the Universe:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Verily this is a Revelation from the Lord of the Worlds:

verses.text: نَزَلَ‌ بِهِ‌ الرُّوحُ‌ الْأَمِينُ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: که روح الامین آن را نازل کرده است،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آن را روح‌الامين نازل كرده است،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: روح الامين آن را نازل كرده است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: «روح الامين» آن را بر دلت نازل كرد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (جبرئیل) روح الامین (فرشته بزرگ خدا) آن را نازل گردانیده.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: جبرئیل آن را فرو آورده است. [[«الرُّوحُ الأمِینُ»: لقب جبریل (ع) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: که روح‌الامین [جبرئیل‌] آن را بر دل تو فرود آورده است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: روح الامین آن را نازل کرده است...

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: فرود آوردش روح الأمین‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: كه روح امين- جبرئيل- آن را فرود آورده است،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: روح‌الامین آن را فرود آورد،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Which the trusted spirit descended with

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: The Trustworthy Spirit brought it down. (Angel Jibreel – peace be upon him.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: brought down by the Faithful Spirit

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: The Trusted spirit hath brought it down.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Which the trustworthy Ruh [Jibrael (Gabriel)] has brought down;

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: The Honest Spirit came down with it.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: which the truthful spirit has carried down

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Which the trustworthy Ruh (Jibril) has brought down.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Which the True Spirit hath brought down

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: brought down by the Trustworthy Spirit

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: The honest Spirit (Gabriel) brought it down

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: The Trustworthy Spirit has brought it down

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: It has been revealed through the trustworthy Spirit

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: The Faithful Spirit has descended with it,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Nazala bihi alrroohu alameenu

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: the Faithful Spirit has brought it down

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: With it came down the spirit of Faith and Truth-

verses.text: عَلَى‌ قَلْبِکَ‌ لِتَکُونَ‌ مِنَ‌ الْمُنْذِرِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بر قلب تو، تا از بیم دهندگان باشی،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بر دل تو، تا از بيم‌دهندگان باشى.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بر قلب تو، تا از بيم دهندگان باشى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: تا از [جمله‌] هشداردهندگان باشى؛

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و آن را بر قلب تو فرود آورده تا از عقاب خدا بترسانی.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بر قلب تو، تا از زمره‌ی بیم دهندگان باشی. [[«قَلْب»: مراد روح پیغمبر است که پایگاه نزول معجزه بزرگ و جاویدان قرآن است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: تا از هشداردهندگان باشی‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بر قلب (پاک) تو، تا از انذارکنندگان باشی!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بر دل تو تا باشی از ترسانندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بر قلب تو تا از بيم‌دهندگان باشى،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بر دلت تا از (جمله‌ی) بیم‌دهندگان باشی؛

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: To (communicate) to your heart that you may be a warner

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Upon your heart, for you to convey warning.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: upon thy heart, that thou mayest be one of the warners,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Upon thy heart, that thou mayest be of the warners,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Upon your heart (O Muhammad SAW) that you may be (one) of the warners,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Upon your heart, that you may be one of the warners.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: to your heart that you might become one of those who warn (others on behalf of Allah),

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Upon your heart that you may be (one) of the warners,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Upon thy heart, that thou mayst be (one) of the warners,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: upon your heart (so that you may be one of the warners),

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: upon your heart (Prophet Muhammad), in order to be one of the warners,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Upon your heart, [O Muhammad] - that you may be of the warners -

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: to your heart, so that you will warn (the people of the dangers of disobeying God).

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Upon your heart that you may be of the warners

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: AAala qalbika litakoona mina almunthireena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: into your heart, so that you may be a warner,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: To thy heart and mind, that thou mayest admonish.

verses.text: بِلِسَانٍ‌ عَرَبِيٍ‌ مُبِينٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: به زبان عربی روشن و گویا

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: به زبان عربى روشن.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: به زبان عربى روشن

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: به زبان عربى روشن،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: به زبان عربی فصیح.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: با زبان عربی روشن و آشکاری است. [[«بِلِسَانٍ»: جار و مجرور متعلّق به فعل (نَزَل) است. «مُبِینٍ»: واضح و روشن (نگا: یوسف / 1).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: به زبان عربی شیوا

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آن را به زبان عربی آشکار (نازل کرد)!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: به زبان عربی آشکار

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: به زبان تازى روشن.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: به زبانی آشکارای بیانگر.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: In eloquent Arabic.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: In plain Arabic language.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: in a clear, Arabic tongue.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: In plain Arabic speech.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: In the plain Arabic language.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: In a clear Arabic tongue.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (a revelation) in clear Arabic language,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: In the plain Arabic language.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: In plain Arabic speech.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: in a clear Arabic language.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: in a clear, Arabic tongue.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: In a clear Arabic language.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: It has been revealed in plain Arabic.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: In plain Arabic language.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Bilisanin AAarabiyyin mubeenin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: in clear Arabic speech.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: In the perspicuous Arabic tongue.

verses.text: وَ إِنَّهُ‌ لَفِي‌ زُبُرِ الْأَوَّلِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و بی تردید [خبر] این [قرآن] در کتاب های پیشینیان است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و آن در نوشته‌هاى پيشينيان نيز هست.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و قطعا [توصيف‌] آن در نوشته‌هاى پيشينيان آمده است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و [وصف‌] آن در كتابهاى پيشينيان آمده است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و (ذکر عظمت) این قرآن در کتب انبیاء پیشین مسطور است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (وصف) این قرآن در کتابهای پیشینیان (از قبیل تورات و انجیل) موجود است. [[«زُبُر»: جمع زَبُور. کتابها (نگا: آل‌عمران / 184، نحل / 44). «إِنَّهُ لَفِی زُبُرِ الأوَّلِینَ»: بیشتر فضائل و عقائد و مواعظ و قصص قرآن و صفات پیغمبر، در کتابهای پیغمبران پیشین موجود بوده است (نگا: بقره / 89، طه / 133، اعلی / 18 و 19). این فرموده، به اعتبار اغلب است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و [خبر] آن در صحف [آسمانی‌] پیشینیان هست‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و توصیف آن در کتابهای پیشینیان نیز آمده است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا آن است در کتب پیشینیان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و همانا [ياد و مژده و گواهى‌] آن در نوشته‌هاى پيشينيان هست.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و همانا (هم)آن همواره در کتاب‌های پشینیان است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: This is (indicated) in the Books of earlier people.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed it is mentioned in the earlier Books.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Truly it is in the Scriptures of the ancients.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And verily it is in the Scriptures of the ancients.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And verily, it (the Quran, and its revelation to Prophet Muhammad SAW) is (announced) in the Scriptures [i.e. the Taurat (Torah) and the Injeel (Gospel)] of former people.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And it is in the scriptures of the ancients.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (a revelation embodied) in the scriptures of the ancients.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And verily, it is in the Zubur of the former people.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And lo! it is in the Scriptures of the men of old.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: It is indeed [foretold] in the scriptures of the ancients.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Truly, it is in the Books of the ancients.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And indeed, it is [mentioned] in the scriptures of former peoples.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Its news was also mentioned in the ancient Books.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And most surely the same is in the scriptures of the ancients.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wainnahu lafee zuburi alawwaleena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Surely, it is foretold in the ancient scriptures.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Without doubt it is (announced) in the mystic Books of former peoples.

verses.text: أَ وَ لَمْ‌ يَکُنْ‌ لَهُمْ‌ آيَةً أَنْ‌ يَعْلَمَهُ‌ عُلَمَاءُ بَنِي‌ إِسْرَائِيلَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا آگاهی دانشمندان بنی اسرائیل به خبر قرآن [در کتاب های پیشینیان] برای مشرکان نشانه ای [بر حقّانیّت قرآن و صدق نبوّت تو] نیست؟!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا اين نشانه برايشان بسنده نيست كه علماى بنى‌اسرائيل از آن آگاهند؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا اين براى آنها دليل و نشانه نيست كه علماى بنى اسرائيل آن را مى‌دانند [و مى‌شناسند]

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا براى آنان، اين خود دليلى روشن نيست كه علماى بنى‌اسرائيل از آن اطّلاع دارند؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا این خود آیت و برهان روشنی (بر کافران) نیست که علماء بنی اسرائیل (از کتب انبیاء سلف) بر این قرآن آگاهند؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا همین نشانه برای (ایمان آوردن) ایشان کافی نیست که علمای بنی‌اسرائیل (به خوبی) از آن آگاهند؟! [[«آیَةً»: نشانه. دلیل و برهان بر صدق رسول. «أَن یَعْلَمَهُ ...»: مراد علم و آگاهی بنی‌اسرائیل از دلائل حقّانیّت قرآن و صدق دعوت است (نگا: بقره / 146، رعد / 43).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا این برای آنان نشانه‌[ی صدق‌] نیست که علمای بنی‌اسرائیل آن را [از پیش‌] می‌شناسند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا همین نشانه برای آنها کافی نیست که علمای بنی اسرائیل بخوبی از آن آگاهند؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا نیست برای ایشان آیتی که بدانندش دانشمندان بنی‌اسرائیل‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا اين براى آنان نشانه‌اى نبود كه دانايان بنى اسرائيل آن را مى‌دانند؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا و برای آنان، (این خود) نشانه‌ای بزرگ نبوده است که علمای بنی‌اسرائیل بدان آگاهند؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Was it not a proof for them that the learned men of Israel knew about this?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And was this not a sign for them, that the scholars of the Descendants of Israel may recognise this Prophet?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Was it not a sign for them, that it is known to the learned of the Children of Israel?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Is it not a sign unto them that the learned among the Children of Isra'il know it?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Is it not a sign to them that the learned scholars (like 'Abdullah bin Salam who embraced Islam) of the Children of Israel knew it (as true)?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Is it not a sign for them that the scholars of the Children of Israel recognized it?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Is it not a Sign to them - (to wit, the Makkans) - that the learned men of the Children of Israel know that?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Is it not a sign to them that the learned scholars of the Children of Israel knew it

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Is it not a token for them that the doctors of the Children of Israel know it?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Is it not a sign for them that the learned of the Children of Israel recognize it?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Was it not a sign for them known to the learned of the Children of Israel?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And has it not been a sign to them that it is recognized by the scholars of the Children of Israel?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Is not the fact (that the Israelite scholars already knew about the Quran through their Book) sufficient evidence for the pagans of the truthfulness (of the Quran)?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Is it not a sign to them that the learned men of the Israelites know it?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Awalam yakun lahum ayatan an yaAAlamahu AAulamao banee israeela

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Is it not evidence enough for them that the learned among the Children of Israel have recognized this [as true]?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Is it not a Sign to them that the Learned of the Children of Israel knew it (as true)?

verses.text: وَ لَوْ نَزَّلْنَاهُ‌ عَلَى‌ بَعْضِ‌ الْأَعْجَمِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و اگر آن را بر برخی از غیر عرب ها نازل کرده بودیم،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اگر آن را بر يكى از عجمان نازل كرده بوديم،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اگر آن را بر برخى از غير عرب‌ها نازل مى‌كرديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اگر آن را بر برخى از غير عرب زبانان نازل مى‌كرديم،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و اگر ما این کتاب (عربی) را بر بعض مردم عجم نازل می‌گردانیدیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: اگر قرآن را بر یکی از غیر عربها نازل می‌کردیم. [[«بَعْضِ»: یکی. فردی. «الأعْجَمِینَ»: غیر عربها. مفرد آن أَعْجَم، یعنی کسی که سخنش برای عربها نامفهوم باشد. عربها به غیر عربها، عجم می‌گویند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و اگر آن را بر بعضی از گنگان بیگانه زبان نازل کرده بودیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: هرگاه ما آن را بر بعضی از عجم [= غیر عرب‌] ها نازل می‌کردیم...

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و اگر می‌فرستادیمش بر یکی از گنگ‌زبانان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و اگر آن

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و اگر آن را بر برخی از عجم‌ها [:غیرعرب‌زبانان] نازل می‌کردیم،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Had We revealed it to a man of obscure tongue

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And had We sent it down upon a person other than an Arab,

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: If We had sent it down on a barbarian

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And had We revealed it unto any of the ncn-Arabs,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And if We had revealed it (this Quran) unto any of the non-Arabs,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Had We revealed it to one of the foreigners.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (But such is their adamance) that had We revealed it to one of the non-Arabs and even if he had recited (this clear Arabic discourse) to them

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And if We had revealed it unto any of the non-Arabs,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And if We had revealed it unto one of any other nation than the Arabs,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Had We sent it down upon some non-Arab

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: If We had revealed it to a nonArab,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And even if We had revealed it to one among the foreigners

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Had We revealed it to a non-Arab

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And if we had revealed it to any of the foreigners

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Walaw nazzalnahu AAala baAAdi alaAAjameena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Had We revealed it to any one of the non-Arabs,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Had We revealed it to any of the non-Arabs,

verses.text: فَقَرَأَهُ‌ عَلَيْهِمْ‌ مَا کَانُوا بِهِ‌ مُؤْمِنِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و او آن را بر عرب ها می خواند، باز هم به آن ایمان نمی آوردند!!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و بر ايشان مى‌خواندش، بدان ايمان نمى‌آوردند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و آن را برايشان مى‌خواند به آن ايمان نمى‌آوردند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و پيامبر آن را برايشان مى‌خواند به آن ايمان نمى‌آوردند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و آن رسول آن را (به زبان تازی) بر عجم‌ها قرائت می‌کرد آنان ایمان نمی‌آوردند (به این عذر که قرآن چون به زبان ما نیست ما فهم آن نکرده و اعجاز آن را درک نمی‌کنیم، اما شما قوم عرب با چه عذر ایمان نمی‌آورید؟)

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و او قرآن را برای آنان می‌خواند (به گونه‌ی کاملاً رسا و گویا و صحیح و زیبا) به آن ایمان نمی‌آوردند. [[«مَا کَانُوا بِهِ مُؤْمِنِینَ»: مراد این است که قرآن چه رسد به این که توسّط پیغمبری از خودشان آمده است، اگر توسّط فردی غیر عرب هم به دستشان می‌رسید و اعجاز آن را بیش از پیش هم می‌دیدند و به فرض می‌دانستند که چنین کلامی ساخته چنین فردی نمی‌تواند باشد، باز هم ایمان نمی‌آوردند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سپس آن را برایشان می‌خواند، به آن ایمان نمی‌آوردند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و او آن را بر ایشان می‌خواند، به آن ایمان نمی‌آورند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس می‌خواندش بر ایشان نبودند بدان ایمان‌آرندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و وى آن را بر ايشان مى‌خواند، بدان ايمان نمى‌آوردند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس پیامبر آن را بر ایشان می‌خواند، به آن ایمان نمی‌آورده‌اند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And he had recited it to them, and they had not believed (it would have been different).

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: In order that he read it to them, even then they would not have believed in it.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and he had recited it to them, they would not have believed in it.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And he had-read it unto them, even then they would not have been believers therein.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And he had recited it unto them, they would not have believed in it.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And he had recited it to them, they still would not have believed in it.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: they would still not have believed in it.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And he had recited it unto them, they would not have believed in it.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And he had read it unto them, they would not have believed in it.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and had he recited it to them, they would not have believed in it.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and he had recited it to them, they would not have believed.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And he had recited it to them [perfectly], they would [still] not have been believers in it.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: who would have read it to them, they (pagans) would not have believed in it.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So that he should have recited it to them, they would not have believed therein.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faqaraahu AAalayhim ma kanoo bihi mumineena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and he had recited it to them, they would not have believed in it.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And had he recited it to them, they would not have believed in it.

verses.text: کَذٰلِکَ‌ سَلَکْنَاهُ‌ فِي‌ قُلُوبِ‌ الْمُجْرِمِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: این گونه [که آن را به زبان عربی روشن و گویا نازل کردیم] در دل های مجرمان درآوردیم [که آن را بفهمند و به آن ایمان آورند،]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بدين‌سان قرآن را در دلهاى مجرمان راه داديم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بدين سان قرآن را در دل‌هاى گناهكاران راه داديم [تا حجت تمام شود]

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: اين گونه در دلهاى گناهكاران، [انكار را] راه مى‌دهيم:

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: ما این قرآن را این چنین در دل تبهکاران گذراندیم (و بر آنها به این کتاب اتمام حجت کردیم).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما این گونه قرآن را (با بیانی گویا و رسا، و به شیوه‌ی ساده و آسان، توسّط فردی از خودشان) به دلهای بزهکاران وارد می‌گردانیم (و فصاحت و بلاغت و اعجاز آن را بدیشان می‌فهمانیم. امّا ...). [[«سَلَکْنَاهُ»: آن را داخل و وارد می‌گردانیم (نگا: حجر / 12).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بدین‌سان آن را در دلهای گناهکاران راه داده‌ایم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (آری،) این گونه (با بیانی رسا) قرآن را در دلهای مجرمان وارد می‌کنیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بدینسان راهش دادیم در دلهای گنهکاران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: اينچنين آن را در دلهاى آن بزهكاران راه داديم

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: این گونه در دل‌های مجرمان، آن (قرآن) را راهی نفوذی دادیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Thus do We cause (unbelief) to enter the hearts of sinners.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: This is how We have made (the habit of) denying embedded in the hearts of the guilty.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Even so We have caused it to enter into the hearts of the sinners,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: In this wise have We made way for it into the hearts of the culprits.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Thus have We caused it (the denial of the Quran) to enter the hearts of the Mujrimun (criminals, polytheists, sinners, etc.).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Thus We make it pass through the hearts of the guilty.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Thus have We caused this (Admonition) to penetrate the hearts of the culprits (like a hot rod).

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Thus have We caused it to enter the hearts of the criminals.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Thus do We make it traverse the hearts of the guilty.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: This is how We let it pass through the hearts of the guilty:

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Even so, We have caused it to enter into the hearts of harmdoers:

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Thus have We inserted disbelief into the hearts of the criminals.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Thus it passes through the hearts of the criminals.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Thus have We caused it to enter into the hearts of the guilty.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Kathalika salaknahu fee quloobi almujrimeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We have thus caused denial of truth to enter into the hearts of the sinners:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Thus have We caused it to enter the hearts of the sinners.

verses.text: لاَ يُؤْمِنُونَ‌ بِهِ‌ حَتَّى‌ يَرَوُا الْعَذَابَ‌ الْأَلِيمَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [ولی این بیمار دلان لجوج] به آن ایمان نمی آورند تا آن عذاب دردناک را ببینند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بدان ايمان نمى‌آورند تا عذاب دردآور را بنگرند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [اما] به آن ايمان نمى‌آورند تا وقتى كه عذاب پردرد را ببينند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: كه به آن نگروند تا عذاب پردرد را ببينند،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: اما به این قرآن ایمان نمی‌آورند تا عذاب دردناک را مشاهده کنند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (امّا ایشان، به سبب دلهای بیماری که دارند) بدان ایمان نمی‌آورند، تا عذاب دردناک را (و مجازات شدیدی را که بدان بیم داده شده بودند) می‌بینند. (امّا چه فایده که دیگر ایمان ایشان پذیرفته و سودمند نیست). [[«الْعَذَاب»: مراد عقاب و عذابی است که از آن بیم داده شده‌اند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: که به آن ایمان نمی‌آورند مگر آنکه عذاب دردناک را بنگرند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (امّا) به آن ایمان نمی‌آورند تا عذاب دردناک را با چشم خود ببینند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: که ایمان نیارند بدان تا ببینند عذاب دردناک را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: به آن ايمان نمى‌آورند تا آنگاه كه عذاب دردناك را ببينند،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: تا عذاب پر دردشان را ننگرند، به آن نگروند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They will not believe it until they behold the painful punishment.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They will not believe in it to the extent that they see the painful punishment.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: who will not believe in it, until they see the painful chastisement

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: They will not believe therein until they behold the torment afflictive.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: They will not believe in it until they see the painful torment;

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They will not believe in it until they witness the painful punishment.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They will not believe in it until they clearly see the grievous chastisement.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: They will not believe in it until they see the painful torment.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: They will not believe in it till they behold the painful doom,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: they do not believe in it until they sight the painful punishment.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: they shall not believe in it until they see the painful punishment

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: They will not believe in it until they see the painful punishment.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They will not believe in it until they suffer the painful torment.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: They will not believe in it until they see the painful punishment.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: La yuminoona bihi hatta yarawoo alAAathaba alaleema

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: they will not believe in it until they see the grievous punishment.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: They will not believe in it until they see the grievous Penalty;

verses.text: فَيَأْتِيَهُمْ‌ بَغْتَةً وَ هُمْ‌ لاَ يَشْعُرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: که ناگهان در حالی که بی خبرند به سراغشان آید،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و آن عذاب ناگهان و بى‌خبر بر آنان فرود مى‌آيد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: كه به طور ناگهانى به سراغشان بيايد در حالى كه توجه ندارند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: كه به طور ناگهانى -در حالى كه بى‌خبرند- بديشان برسد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که به ناگاه آن عذاب که سخت از آن غافلند به آنها فرا رسد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: عذاب، ناگهانی گریبانگیر ایشان می‌گردد. به گونه‌ای که نمی‌فهمند (چگونه و از کجا سر رسیده است). [[«بَغْتَةً»: ناگهانی. «وَ هُمْ لا یَشْعُرُونَ»: به گونه‌ای که از آمدن آن خبردار و آگاه نمی‌شوند و غافلگیر می‌گردند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: که ناگهانی بر سر آنان آید و آنان آگاه نباشند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ناگهان به سراغشان می‌آید، در حالی که توجّه ندارند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: که بیایدشان ناگاه و ایشان ندانند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: كه ناگهان و در حالى كه آگاه نباشند بديشان رسد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس (آن عذاب) ناگهان -در حالی که باریک‌بینی نمی‌کنند- بدیشان در رسد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: It will come upon them unawares, and they will not comprehend it.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So it will come upon them suddenly, whilst they will be unaware.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: so that it will come upon them suddenly, while they are not aware,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: It shall come unto them on a sudden, and they shall not perceive.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: It shall come to them of a sudden, while they perceive it not;

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: It will come to them suddenly, while they are unaware.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: But when it comes upon them suddenly, taking them unawares,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: It shall come to them of a sudden, while they perceive it not.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: So that it will come upon them suddenly, when they perceive not.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: It will overtake them suddenly while they are unaware.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: so that it will come upon them suddenly, while they are unaware,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And it will come to them suddenly while they perceive [it] not.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The torment will strike them suddenly without their knowledge.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And it shall come to them all of a sudden, while they shall not perceive;

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fayatiyahum baghtatan wahum la yashAAuroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: It will come upon them suddenly when they are not expecting it.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But the (Penalty) will come to them of a sudden, while they perceive it not;

verses.text: فَيَقُولُوا هَلْ‌ نَحْنُ‌ مُنْظَرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس [در آن موقعیت بسیار سخت] گویند: آیا ما مهلت می یابیم؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: مى‌گويند: آيا ما را مهلتى خواهند داد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [و در آن هنگام‌] مى‌گويند: آيا ما را مهلتى داده خواهد شد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و بگويند: «آيا مهلت خواهيم يافت؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و آن کافران گویند: آیا بر ما مهلتی منظور می‌شود (تا زمانی از عذاب بیاساییم؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (و به هنگام نزول عذاب فریاد برمی‌آورند) و می‌گویند: آیا به ما مهلتی و فرصتی داده می‌شود؟! (آخر اکنون همه چیز را می‌دانیم و سخت پشیمانیم و گوش بفرمانیم! مگر چنین چیزی ممکن است؟!). [[«مُنظَرُونَ»: مهلت داده شدگان (نگا: اعراف / 15، حجر / 8 و 37). «هَلْ نَحْنُ مُنظَرُونَ»: این جمله می‌تواند بیانگر قطع امید و اظهار تأسّف ایشان باشد، و یا این که بیانگر درخواست بی‌پاسخ آنان بشمار آید.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنگاه گویند آیا ما مهلت یافته خواهیم بود؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و (در آن هنگام) می‌گویند: «آیا به ما مهلتی داده خواهد شد؟!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس گویند آیا مائیم مهلت‌دادگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس گويند: آيا مهلتى به ما خواهند داد؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس بگویند: «آیا ما مهلت داده شدگانیم؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Then will they say: "Can we be given respite?"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They will therefore say, “Will we get some respite?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and they will say, 'Shall we be respited?'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then they will say: are we to be respited?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then they will say: "Can we be respited?"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then they will say, “Are we given any respite?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: they say: "Can we be granted some respite?"

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then they will say: "Can we be respited"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then they will say: Are we to be reprieved?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Thereupon they will say, ‘Shall we be granted any respite?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and then they will say: 'Shall we be respited'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And they will say, "May we be reprieved?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They will say, "Can we be granted any respite?"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then they will say: Shall we be respited?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fayaqooloo hal nahnu muntharoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Then they will exclaim, "Could we have some respite?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then they will say: "Shall we be respited?"

verses.text: أَ فَبِعَذَابِنَا يَسْتَعْجِلُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا به آمدن عذاب ما شتاب می کنند؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا به عذاب ما مى‌شتابند؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا به عذاب ما عجله مى‌كنند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس آيا عذاب ما را به شتاب مى‌خواهند؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا (اکنون که هنگام عذابشان نیست از تمسخر) عذاب و انتقام ما را به تعجیل می‌طلبند؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا درخواست سرعت گرفتن و جلو افتادن (نزول) عذاب ما را داشتند؟! [[«یَسْتَعْجِلُونَ»: درخواست جلو انداختن دارند. درخواست می‌نمایند عذاب پیش از زمان خود فرا رسد. اشاره به این است که کافران بارها تمسخرکنان به پیغمبران می‌گفتند: هر چه زودتر خدا عذابی را که ما را از آن می‌ترسانید به ما برساند (نگا: اعراف / 70 و 77، انفال / 32، هود / 32، عنکبوت / 29، احقاف / 22).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس آیا عذاب ما را به شتاب می‌خواهند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا برای عذاب ما عجله می‌کنند؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا به عذاب ما می‌شتابند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا به عذاب ما مى‌شتابند؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس آیا عذاب ما را بس شتابان می‌خواهند؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Do they wish Us then to hasten the punishment?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So do they wish to hasten Our punishment?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: What, do they seek to hasten Our chastisement?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Seek haste then they with our torment?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Would they then wish for Our Torment to be hastened on?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Do they seek to hasten Our punishment?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Do they really want Our chastisement to be expedited?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Would they then wish for Our torment to be hastened on

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Would they (now) hasten on Our doom?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So do they seek to hasten on Our punishment?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Do they wish to hasten Our punishment?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So for Our punishment are they impatient?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do they want to hasten Our torment?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: What! do they still seek to hasten on Our punishment?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: AfabiAAathabina yastaAAjiloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Do they want to hasten Our punishment?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Do they then ask for Our Penalty to be hastened on?

verses.text: أَ فَرَأَيْتَ‌ إِنْ‌ مَتَّعْنَاهُمْ‌ سِنِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس خبر ده اگر ما آنان را سالیانی بهره مندی و برخورداری دهیم،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ديدى كه هر چند سالها برخوردارشان ساختيم،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: به ما بگو كه اگر ساليانى آنها را از زندگى برخوردار كنيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: مگر نمى‌دانى كه اگر سالها آنان را برخوردار كنيم،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: چه خواهی دید اگر ما چند سالی آنها را در دنیا متنعّم سازیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بگو ببینم، اگر ما سالهای دیگری ایشان را (از این زندگی دنیا) بهره‌مند سازیم (و با خوشی و خرّمی مدّت دیگری را بسر ببرند). [[«اَفَرَأَیْتَ»: به من بگو. بیان کن (نگا: مریم / 77، فرقان / 43). «سِنِینَ»: سالها.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: ملاحظه کن که اگر سالها برخوردارشان سازیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: به ما خبر ده، اگر (باز هم) سالیانی آنها را از این زندگی بهره‌مند سازیم...

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا دیده باشی که اگر کامروا گردانیمشان سالیانی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا ديدى- دانستى- كه اگر آنان را سالها برخوردارى دهيم،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس مگر دیدی اگر سال‌ها آنان را برخوردار کنیم؛

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Just think: If We let them enjoy (the good things of life) for a few years more,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Therefore observe, that if We give them some comforts for some years, –

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: What thinkest thou? If We give them enjoyment of days for many years,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Beholdest thou? - if We let them enjoy for years.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Tell Me, if We do let them enjoy for years,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Have you considered: if We let them enjoy themselves for some years.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Did you consider that if We were to let them enjoy life for many years

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Think, if We do let them enjoy for years,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Hast thou then seen, if We content them for (long) years,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Tell me, should We let them enjoy for some years,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: What do you see? If We gave them enjoyment for years,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then have you considered if We gave them enjoyment for years

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do you not see that even if We give them respite for years

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Have you then considered if We let them enjoy themselves for years,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Afaraayta in mattaAAnahum sineena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Think! If We let them enjoy life for some years,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Seest thou? If We do let them enjoy (this life) for a few years,

verses.text: ثُمَ‌ جَاءَهُمْ‌ مَا کَانُوا يُوعَدُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: سپس آن عذابی که به آن تهدید می شدند، به سراغشان آید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: باز هم عذابى كه به آنها وعده شده بود بر سرشان آمد،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آن‌گاه عذاب موعود بر سرشان بيايد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و آنگاه آنچه كه [بدان‌] بيم داده مى‌شوند بديشان برسد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: سپس به عذابی که بر آنان وعده شده یکسر هلاک شوند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: سپس عذابی که به آنان وعده داده می‌شود، دامنگیرشان گردد. [[«مَا»: فاعل فعل (جَآءَ) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سپس آنچه از آن بیمشان داده‌ایم، به سراغ آنان آید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: سپس عذابی که به آنها وعده داده شده به سراغشان بیاید...

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس بیایدشان آنچه وعده داده می‌شوند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: سپس آنچه وعده داده مى‌شدند بديشان آيد،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (و) سپس آنچه (که) وعده داده شده‌اند به سراغشان آمد؛

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And then what they were promised comes upon them,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And then the promise that is given to them, does come upon them-

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: then there comes on them that they were promised,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And then there cometh unto them that which they had been promised.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And afterwards comes to them that (punishment) which they had been promised!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then there comes to them what they were promised.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and then the chastisement of which they were being warned were to come upon them,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And afterwards comes to them that which they had been promised.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And then cometh that which they were promised,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: then there comes to them what they have been promised,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and then what they were promised comes to them,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And then there came to them that which they were promised?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and then Our torment will strike them,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then there comes to them that with which they are threatened,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Thumma jaahum ma kanoo yooAAadoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and then the promised punishment fell upon them,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Yet there comes to them at length the (Punishment) which they were promised!

verses.text: مَا أَغْنَى‌ عَنْهُمْ‌ مَا کَانُوا يُمَتَّعُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آنچه را [چند سال] همواره از آن برخورداری می یافتند [عذاب را] از آنان دفعنخواهد کرد،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آن برخورداريها به حالشان سود نكرد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آنچه از زندگى برخوردار شده بودند چه [عذابى را] از آنها دفع خواهد كرد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آنچه از آن برخوردار مى‌شدند، به كارشان نمى‌آيد [و عذاب را از آنان دفع نمى‌كند]؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا بهره‌ای که از مال دنیا داشتند هیچ آنها را از عذاب خواهد رهانید؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: این تمتّع و بهره‌گیری از دنیا، برای آنان چه سودی خواهد داشت؟ [[«مَا»: واژه نخستین استفهامیّه، و واژه دوم موصوله یا مصدریّه است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آن برخورداریشان به کار آنان نیاید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: این تمتع و بهره‌گیری از دنیا برای آنها سودی نخواهد داشت!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بی نیاز نکند از ایشان آنچه بودند بهره‌ور می‌شدند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آنچه برخوردارى يافته بودند سودى برايشان [در دفع عذاب‌] نخواهد داشت.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آنچه از آن برخوردار می‌شده‌اند، بی‌نیازشان نکرد (و عذاب را از آنان دفع ننمود).

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Of what avail shall their enjoyment be to them?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So of what benefit will be the comforts that they were using?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: what will it then avail them, the enjoyment of days they were given?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: What shall that which they enjoyed avail them?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: All that with which they used to enjoy shall not avail them.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Of what avail to them will be their past enjoyments?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: of what avail will be the provisions of life which they have been granted to enjoy?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: All that with which they used to enjoy shall not avail them.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: (How) that wherewith they were contented naught availeth them?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: of what avail to them will be that which they were given to enjoy?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: what avail will their past enjoyments be to them?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: They would not be availed by the enjoyment with which they were provided.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: none of their luxuries will be able to save them from the torment?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: That which they were made to enjoy shall not avail them?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Ma aghna AAanhum ma kanoo yumattaAAoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: of what avail would their past enjoyment be to them?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: It will profit them not that they enjoyed (this life)!

verses.text: وَ مَا أَهْلَکْنَا مِنْ‌ قَرْيَةٍ إِلاَّ لَهَا مُنْذِرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و [مردم] هیچ شهری را نابود نکردیم مگر آنکه بیم دهندگانی برای آنان بود،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ما هيچ قريه‌اى را هلاك نكرديم جز آنكه برايشان بيم‌دهندگانى بودند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و [اهل‌] هيچ شهرى را هلاك نكرديم مگر اين كه براى آنها هشدار دهندگانى بود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و هيچ شهرى را هلاك نكرديم مگر آنكه براى آن هشداردهندگانى بود.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و ما اهل هیچ دیاری را تا رسولانی به هدایت و اتمام حجت بر آنها نفرستادیم هلاک نکردیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما اهل هیچ شهر و دیاری را هلاک نکرده‌ایم، مگر این که بیم دهندگانی (از پیغمبران) داشته‌اند (و قبلاً به میان ایشان رفته‌اند و به اندرز و رهنمودشان برخاسته‌اند و آنان را به اوامر و نواهی خدا آشنا ساخته‌اند). [[«قَرْیَةٍ»: شهر و دیار. مراد ساکنان آنجا است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و [اهل‌] هیچ شهری را نابود نکردیم مگر آنکه هشداردهندگانی داشتند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ما هیچ شهر و دیاری را هلاک نکردیم مگر اینکه انذارکنندگانی (از پیامبران الهی) داشتند.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و نابود نساختیم شهری را مگر برای آن بود ترسانندگانی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و [مردم‌] هيچ شهرى را نابود نكرديم مگر آنكه آن را بيم‌دهندگانى بود،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و (ما) هیچ مجتمعی را هلاک نکردیم مگر آنکه برایشان بیم‌دهندگانی باشند،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Never have We destroyed a habitation till We had sent admonishers to them

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And never did We destroy a township which did not have Heralds of warning, –

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Never a city We destroyed, but it had warners

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We destroyed not a city but it had its warners.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And never did We destroy a township, but it had its warners

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Never did We destroy a town, but it had warners.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: We never destroyed any habitation but that it had warners

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And never did We destroy a township but it had its warners

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And We destroyed no township but it had its warners

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: We have not destroyed any town without its having warners,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We never destroyed a village that did not have warners

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We did not destroy any city except that it had warners

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We never destroyed any town without first sending to them warning and guidance.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We did not destroy any town but it had (its) warners,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wama ahlakna min qaryatin illa laha munthiroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Never have We destroyed a town without sending down messengers to warn it,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Never did We destroy a population, but had its warners -

verses.text: ذِکْرَى‌ وَ مَا کُنَّا ظَالِمِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: برای اندرز دادن و اتمام حجت؛ و ما هرگز ستمکار نبوده ایم [که مردمی را بدون فرستادن پیامبر نابود کنیم.]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: تا پندشان دهند. زيرا ما ستمكار نيستيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: تا آنان را تذكّر دهند، و ما ستمكار نبوده‌ايم [كه اتمام حجت نكنيم‌]

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [تا آنان را] تذكر [دهند]؛ و ما ستمكار نبوده‌ايم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: این (هلاک بدان) پند و موعظه است (برای خوبان) و ما هرگز به کسی ستم نکردیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: تا متذکّر شوند و بیدار گردند. ما هرگز ستمگر نبوده‌ایم (تا پیش از ارسال پیغمبران و اتمام حجّت بر مردمان، ایشان را عذاب دهیم). [[«ذِکْری»: یادآوری و عبرت. مفعول له است. یا خبر مبتدای محذوف و تقدیر چنین است: هذِهِ ذِکْری ....]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [برای‌] پندآموزی، و ما ستمگر نبوده‌ایم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: تا متذکّر شوند؛ و ما هرگز ستمکار نبودیم! (که بدون اتمام حجّت مجازات کنیم)

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: یادآوردنی است و نیستیم ما ستمکاران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: تا يادآورى و پندى باشد، و ما ستمكار نبوديم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (تا آنان را) یادواره‌ای (باشد). و ما ستمکار نبوده‌ایم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: To warn. For We are never unjust.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: To advise; and We never oppress.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: for a reminder; and never did We wrong.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: By way of admonition, and We have never been oppressors.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: By way of reminder, and We have never been unjust.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: As a reminder—We are never unjust.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: to admonish them. We have never been unjust.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: By way of reminder, and We have never been unjust.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: For reminder, for We never were oppressors.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: for the sake of admonition, and We were not unjust.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: for a reminder, and We never harmed.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: As a reminder; and never have We been unjust.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We have never been unjust to anyone.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: To remind, and We are never unjust.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Thikra wama kunna thalimeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: as a reminder from Us: We are never unjust.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: By way of reminder; and We never are unjust.

verses.text: وَ مَا تَنَزَّلَتْ‌ بِهِ‌ الشَّيَاطِينُ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: قرآن را شیطان ها نازل نکرده اند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و اين قرآن را شياطين نازل نكرده‌اند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و آن [قرآن‌] را شياطين نازل نكرده‌اند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و شيطانها آن را فرود نياورده‌اند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و این قرآن را شیاطین فرود نیاوردند (بلکه جبرئیل امین، فرشته خدا نازل ساخته).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: این قرآن را شیاطین فرو نیاورده‌اند (و بلکه جبریل آن را فرو آورده است). [[«مَا تَنَزَّلَتْ ...»: مشرکان می‌گفتند: جنّیان و شیاطین قرآن را به محمّد می‌رسانند، و او همچون کاهنان الهامات و اطّلاعات خود را از ایشان دریافت می‌دارد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و آن را شیاطین نازل نکرده‌اند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: شیاطین و جنیّان (هرگز) این آیات را نازل نکردند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و فرود نیاوردندش شیاطین‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و اين قرآن را ديوان فرود نياوردند

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و شیطان‌ها آن را فرود نیاورده‌اند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: The devils did not bring it down:

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And this Qur’an was not brought down by the devils.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Not by the Satans has it been brought down;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And the satans have not brought it down.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And it is not the Shayatin (devils) who have brought it (this Quran) down,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: It was not the devils that revealed it.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: The satans did not bring down this (Clear Book),

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And it is not the Shayatin (devils) who have brought it down.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: The devils did not bring it down.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: It has not been brought down by the devils.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: It was not the satans who brought it down:

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And the devils have not brought the revelation down.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The satans have not revealed the Quran;

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And the Shaitans have not come down with it.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wama tanazzalat bihi alshshayateenu

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: It was not the devils who brought down the Quran:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: No evil ones have brought down this (Revelation):

verses.text: وَ مَا يَنْبَغِي‌ لَهُمْ‌ وَ مَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و [نزول قرآن] سزاوار آنان نیست، و قدرت [وحی کردن چنین کتابی را] ندارند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آنان نه درخور اين كارند و نه توان آن دارند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و آنها را نسزد و نمى‌توانند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و آنان را نسزد و نمى‌توانند [وحى كنند].

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: نه هرگز این گونه سخنان از شیاطین شایسته است و نه قدرت (بر نزول آن) دارند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (اصلاً این کار) ایشان را نسزد، و توانائی (چنین کاری را) ندارند. [[«مَا یَنْبَغِی لَهُمْ»: ایشان را نسزد. سزاوار آن نیستند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و آنان را نرسد، و چنین کاری نتوانند کرد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و برای آنها سزاوار نیست؛ و قدرت ندارند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و نسزد ایشان را و نتوانند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: نه آنان را سزد و نه توانند

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و هرگز برایشان سزاوار (هم) نیست و (هم) نمی‌توانسته‌اند (آن را فرود آورند).

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They are not worthy of it, nor have they power.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They are unworthy of it, nor can they do it.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: it behoves them not, neither are they able.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: It behoveth them not, nor they can.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Neither would it suit them, nor they can (produce it).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: It is not in their interests, nor in their power.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: nor does it behove them, nor does it lie in their power.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Neither would it suit them nor are they able.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: It is not meet for them, nor is it in their power,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Neither does it behoove them, nor are they capable [of doing that].

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: it is not for them, nor are they able.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: It is not allowable for them, nor would they be able.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: they are not supposed to do so. Nor do have they the ability for such a task.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And it behoves them not, and they have not the power to do (it).

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wama yanbaghee lahum wama yastateeAAoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: neither are they worthy of it, nor are they capable of it,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: It would neither suit them nor would they be able (to produce it).

verses.text: إِنَّهُمْ‌ عَنِ‌ السَّمْعِ‌ لَمَعْزُولُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بی تردید آنان از شنیدن [وحی الهی و اخبار ملکوتی] محروم و برکنارند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: شياطين را از شنيدن وحى معزول داشته‌اند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بى‌ترديد آنها از شنيدن [وحى‌] منع شده‌اند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: در حقيقت آنها از شنيدن، معزول [و محروم‌]اند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که البته آنها از استماع وحی الهی معزولند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: قطعاً ایشان از گوش فرا دادن (به فرشتگان و دریافت پیام آسمانی از ایشان) محروم و برکنارند. [[«السَّمْع»: گوش فرا دادن و شنیدن (نگا: حجر / 9، جنّ / 8 و 9).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: چرا که ایشان از شنیدن [وحی‌] برکنار هستند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنها از استراق سمع (و شنیدن اخبار آسمانها) برکنارند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا ایشانند از شنیدن دورماندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: همانا آنان از شنيدن [وحى و گفتار فرشتگان‌] دور داشته و بركنارشدگانند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آنان بی‌گمان از شنیدن (آن وحی ربانی) همواره وازده‌شدگانند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They have been precluded from hearing it.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Indeed they have been banished from the place of hearing.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Truly, they are expelled from hearing.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily far from hearing are they removed.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily, they have been removed far from hearing it.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They are barred from hearing.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Indeed they are debarred from even hearing it.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, they have been removed far from hearing it.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! verily they are banished from the hearing.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed, they are kept at bay [even] from hearing it.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Truly, they are expelled from hearing.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed they, from [its] hearing, are removed.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The satans are barred from listening to anything from the heavens.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Most surely they are far removed from the hearing of it.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Innahum AAani alssamAAi lamaAAzooloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: indeed they are debarred from overhearing it.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Indeed they have been removed far from even (a chance of) hearing it.

verses.text: فَلاَ تَدْعُ‌ مَعَ‌ اللَّهِ‌ إِلٰهاً آخَرَ فَتَکُونَ‌ مِنَ‌ الْمُعَذَّبِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس با خدا معبودی دیگر را مپرست، که از عذاب شدگان خواهی شد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس با خداى يكتا خداى ديگرى را مخوان تا مباد در شمار مستحقان عذاب درآيى.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس با خدا معبودى ديگر مخوان كه از عذاب شدگان مى‌گردى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس با خدا، خداى ديگر مخوان كه از عذاب‌شدگان خواهى شد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس با خدای یکتا احدی را معبود مخوان و گرنه از اهل عذاب خواهی شد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بجز خدا معبودی را به فریاد مخوان و پرستش مکن، که (اگر چنین کنی) از زمره‌ی عذاب شوندگان خواهی بود. [[«لا تَدْعُ»: به فریاد مخوان. به کمک مطلب. پرستش مکن. «مَعَ اللهِ»: با خدا. مراد بجز خدا است. «فَتَکُونَ ...»: مخاطب پیغمبر و مراد افراد امّت است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس در جنب خداوند خدایی دیگر [به نیایش‌] مخوان که از عذاب دیدگان خواهی شد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (ای پیامبر!) هیچ معبودی را با خداوند مخوان، که از معذّبین خواهی بود!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس نخوان با خدا خدائی دیگر را که باشی از عذاب‌شدگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس با خداى يكتا خدايى ديگر مخوان كه آنگاه از عذاب‌شوندگان باشى.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس با خدا، معبودی دیگر مخوان. (مباد که) از عذاب‌شدگان باشی.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So call on no other god but God, lest you are condemned to torment;

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Therefore do not worship another deity along with Allah, for you will be punished.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So call thou not upon another god with God, lest thou shouldst be one of those that are chastised.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: So call not thou unto anot her god along with Allah, lest thou be of the doomed.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So invoke not with Allah another ilah (god) lest you be among those who receive punishment.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So do not pray to another god with God, else you will be of those tormented.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: So do not call any other god beside Allah lest you become of those who will be punished,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So, invoke not with Allah another god lest you should be among those who receive punishment.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Therefor invoke not with Allah another god, lest thou be one of the doomed.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So do not invoke any god besides Allah, lest you should be among the punished.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: So do not call upon another god with Allah, lest you should be one of those who are punished.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So do not invoke with Allah another deity and [thus] be among the punished.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), do not worship anything besides God lest you suffer the punishment.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So call not upon another god with Allah, lest you be of those who are punished.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fala tadAAu maAAa Allahi ilahan akhara fatakoona mina almuAAaththabeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: So do not call on any deity besides God, lest you incur His punishment.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So call not on any other god with Allah, or thou wilt be among those under the Penalty.

verses.text: وَ أَنْذِرْ عَشِيرَتَکَ‌ الْأَقْرَبِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و خویشان نزدیکت را [از عاقبت اعمال زشت] هشدار ده،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: خويشاوندان نزديكت را بترسان.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و خويشان نزديك را هشدار ده

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و خويشان نزديكت را هشدار ده.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و (نخست) خویشان نزدیکت را (از خدا) بترسان.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: خویشاوندان نزدیک خود را (از شرک و مخالفت با فرمان پروردگار) بترسان (و آنان را به سوی توحید و دادگری فرا خوان). [[«عَشِیرَة»: وابستگان و خویشان (نگا: توبه / 24).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و خاندان خویشاوندت را هشدار ده‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و خویشاوندان نزدیکت را انذار کن!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و بترسان خویشاوندان خویش را نزدیکان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و خويشاوندان نزديك خود را بيم كن.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و نزدیکترین نزدیکانت را (از هنگامه‌ی رستاخیز) بیم ده.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And warn your near relations,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And O dear Prophet (Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him), warn your closest relatives.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And warn thy clan, thy nearest kin.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And warn thou thy clan, the nearest ones.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And warn your tribe (O Muhammad SAW) of near kindred.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And warn your close relatives.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and warn your nearest kinsmen;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And warn your tribe of near kindred.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And warn thy tribe of near kindred,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Warn the nearest of your kinsfolk,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Warn your tribe and your near kinsmen.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And warn, [O Muhammad], your closest kindred.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Warn your close relatives

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And warn your nearest relations,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waanthir AAasheerataka alaqrabeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Warn your nearest kinsmen,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And admonish thy nearest kinsmen,

verses.text: وَ اخْفِضْ‌ جَنَاحَکَ‌ لِمَنِ‌ اتَّبَعَکَ‌ مِنَ‌ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و پر و بال [فروتنی و تواضع] خود را برای مؤمنانی که از تو پیروی می کنند بگستر،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: در برابر هر يك از مؤمنان كه از تو پيروى مى‌كند بال فروتنى فرودآر.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و براى آن مؤمنانى كه تو را پيروى كرده‌اند بال [محبت‌] بگستر

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و براى آن مؤمنانى كه تو را پيروى كرده‌اند، بال خود را فرو گستر.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و پر و بال مرحمت بر تمام پیروان با ایمانت به تواضع بگستران.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و بال (محبّت و مودّت) خود را برای مؤمنانی که از تو پیروی می‌کنند بگستران. [[«إِخْفِضْ جَنَاحَکَ»: بگستران بال خود را. مراد نرمخوئی و فروتنی و مهربانی است (نگا: حجر / 88).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و در برابر مؤمنانی که از تو پیروی می‌کنند مهربان و فروتن باش‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و بال و پر خود را برای مؤمنانی که از تو پیروی می‌کنند بگستر!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و فرود کن بال خود را برای هر که پیرویت کند از مؤمنان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و بال [مِهر و نرمى‌] خويش را براى كسانى از مؤمنان كه تو را پيروى كردند فرود آر.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و برای آن مؤمنانی که تو را پیروی کرده‌اند، بال خود را فرو گستر.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And take those believers under your wing who follow you.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And spread your wing of mercy for the believers following you.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Lower thy wing to those who follow thee, being believers;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And lower thou thy Wlng Unto those who follow thee as believers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And be kind and humble to the believers who follow you.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And lower your wing to those of the believers who follow you.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and be meek to the believers who follow you.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And be kind and humble to the believers who follow you.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And lower thy wing (in kindness) unto those believers who follow thee.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and lower your wing to the faithful who follow you.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and lower your wing to the believers who follow you.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And lower your wing to those who follow you of the believers.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and be kind to your believing followers.
